opportunities.title: RockEDU Summer Science Research Program
opportunities.description: Insightful elective courses, guest lectures, and workshops. Insight into the SSRP every summer.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 7-week summer science research program at Rockefeller University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Rockefeller University welcomes 32 students into the SSRP every summer. Over the course of seven weeks, students and their mentors will work in four research groups. The 2026 session will run from June 22 through August 6.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research in assigned laboratory groups
  • Attend elective courses and guest lectures
  • Participate in workshops and mentorship sessions

Requirements:

  • Must be aged 16+ at the start of the program
  • Strong interest in biomedical research
  • Commitment to the full 7-week duration

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship from leading scientists
  • Insightful elective courses and workshops
  • Exposure to a world-class research environment
opportunities.applicationProcess: Applications are submitted online. Students must complete an application form and request a reference from a mentor/teacher. Detailed essays are typically required.

opportunities.title: Research Science Institute (RSI)
opportunities.description: Mentorship by accomplished professors and experienced researchers. Highly selective program at MIT.
opportunities.shortDescription: A highly selective 6-week research program for juniors at MIT.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This highly selective program brings together 100 STEM-minded juniors from the U.S. and abroad to the MIT campus. The first week is dedicated to intensive STEM classes, and you’ll spend the rest of the time working on individual projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete intensive STEM coursework in the first week
  • Conduct individual research projects under mentorship
  • Read current literature in your field
  • Prepare and deliver a final written and oral report

Requirements:

  • Current High School Juniors only
  • Exceptional academic record in math and science
  • Demonstrated potential for leadership in science

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship by accomplished professors
  • Access to MIT campus resources
  • Networking with top global STEM students
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via the Center for Excellence in Education (CEE) portal. Requires high school transcript, standardized test scores (PSAT/SAT/ACT), and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Applied Research Innovations in Science and Engineering (ARISE)
opportunities.description: Diverse networking opportunities and social events. Work in one of NYU's 80+ research labs.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 10-week free summer research program for NYC students at NYU.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This free summer program will help you develop foundational research skills in STEM. You’ll be working in one of NYU’s 80+ research labs and receive a $1,000 stipend.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in a faculty lab for 10 weeks
  • Attend weekly workshops and events
  • Present research findings at a colloquium

Requirements:

  • Rising juniors and seniors
  • Must be a current NYC resident
  • Strong interest in STEM disciplines

What We Offer:

  • $1,000 Stipend
  • Foundational research skills training
  • Diverse networking opportunities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including essays and transcript. Selected candidates are invited for group interviews and lab tours.

opportunities.title: Simons Summer Research Program
opportunities.description: 15+ areas of knowledge to choose from. Hands-on research in science, engineering, and math.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 6-week hands-on research program at Stony Brook University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Stony Brook University welcomes students interested in hands-on research in science, engineering, and math. You can choose to stay on campus (housing fees apply) or commute.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in daily research activities
  • Participate in weekly faculty research talks
  • Produce a written research abstract and poster

Requirements:

  • Currently in 11th grade
  • Must be aged 16+ by the start of the program
  • United States citizenship or permanent residency

What We Offer:

  • Choice of 15+ research areas
  • Experience at a major research university
  • Opportunity to live on campus (optional)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Students must be nominated by their high school to apply. Following nomination, students submit an online application with essays and recommendations.

opportunities.title: RISE at Boston University
opportunities.description: Internship and practicum tracks to choose from. Engage in research in one of 15 fields.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 6-week research program offering Internship and Practicum tracks at BU.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Boston University offers you the opportunity to engage in research in one of 15 fields under the guidance of a mentor. The program comes with tuition fees ($6,185 in 2025), but limited financial aid is available.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research 40 hours per week (Internship track)
  • Participate in structured group research (Practicum track)
  • Attend weekly workshops on scientific communication

Requirements:

  • Rising seniors (current juniors)
  • Domestic and international students eligible
  • Strong academic recommendation

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship by BU faculty
  • College credit opportunities
  • Social activities and campus life experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring essays, high school transcript, and recommendations from a science teacher and counselor.

opportunities.title: Wistar’s High School Summer Program in Biomedical Research
opportunities.description: Solid introduction into biomedical careers. Immerses participants in the ins and outs of biomedical research.
opportunities.shortDescription: A 4-week biomedical research immersion in Philadelphia.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Taking place at the Wistar Institute, this program immerses its 15 motivated participants in the ins and outs of biomedical research. You don’t need any previous research experience to apply. A $1,500 stipend is available.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn laboratory techniques and safety
  • Assist with ongoing biomedical projects
  • Attend seminars and career development sessions

Requirements:

  • Aged 16+ by program start
  • Completed at least one high school science course
  • Availability for the full 4 weeks

What We Offer:

  • $1,500 stipend
  • Solid introduction to biomedical careers
  • Hands-on lab experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Submit an online application. No prior research experience is required, but a strong interest in science is necessary.

opportunities.title: Careers in Science (CiS)
opportunities.description: Year-round engagement with hands-on experience in science careers. Paid internship program.
opportunities.shortDescription: A multi-year paid internship at the California Academy of Sciences.
opportunities.fullDescription:
With this paid internship program, the California Academy of Sciences strives to make STEM careers more accessible to traditionally underrepresented communities. You’ll be paid above minimum wage for your participation.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in science education and fieldwork
  • Work on research projects with Academy scientists
  • Attend training sessions and leadership workshops

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • San Francisco residents preferred
  • Commitment to a multi-year program

What We Offer:

  • Paid above minimum wage
  • Long-term mentorship
  • Year-round engagement
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application typically due in April. Includes personal statement and optional letter of recommendation. Interviews follow for semi-finalists.

opportunities.title: NASA Internship Programs
opportunities.description: Diverse in-person/hybrid/virtual opportunities. Over 2,000 students take part every year.
opportunities.shortDescription: Various internships at NASA centers nationwide.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every year, over 2,000 students take part in NASA’s many internships and research programs. Opportunities vary by center and project, offering in-person, hybrid, and virtual options.

Responsibilities:

  • Support NASA projects in engineering, science, or operations
  • Collaborate with NASA mentors
  • Complete a final presentation or project

Requirements:

  • U.S. Citizenship
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA
  • At least 16 years of age

What We Offer:

  • Exposure to space exploration missions
  • Professional networking within NASA
  • Stipend (varies by academic level)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply through the official NASA STEM Gateway. One application can be used for multiple opportunities.

opportunities.title: Student Historian Internship Program
opportunities.description: Year-round program with a focus on history research. Test drive a career as a historian.
opportunities.shortDescription: A history-focused internship at the New York Historical Society.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Ever dreamed of becoming a historian? The New York Historical Society will help you test drive this career. Participants receive a $700 stipend. The museum selects 25 interns per cohort.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct historical research
  • Develop digital projects or tours
  • Engage with museum visitors

Requirements:

  • Entering grades 10-12
  • Must reside in the NYC metro area
  • Interest in history and museums

What We Offer:

  • $700 Stipend
  • Behind-the-scenes museum access
  • Public speaking and research skills
opportunities.applicationProcess: Submit online application including short essays. Finalists are invited for group interviews.

opportunities.title: BRAINYAC
opportunities.description: Access to Columbia laboratories with cutting-edge equipment. Neuroscience-focused research.
opportunities.shortDescription: Neuroscience research experience for NYC youth at Columbia University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every summer, the Zuckerman Institute’s program invites high schoolers from partner programs to participate in neuroscience-focused research. The program is organized in collaboration with Columbia University.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn laboratory techniques
  • Work on a designated neuroscience project
  • Present findings at a poster session

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11
  • Must be enrolled in specific partner programs (S-PREP, Lang, etc.)
  • NYC residents only

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Access to cutting-edge Columbia labs
  • Mentorship from neuroscientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application available through partner programs. Contact the Zuckerman Institute for list of qualifying partner organizations.

opportunities.title: JAX Summer Student Program
opportunities.description: Focus on laboratory discovery and scientific communication. Intensive 10-week program.
opportunities.shortDescription: Genetics and genomics research program at The Jackson Laboratory.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Interested in genome research? The Jackson Laboratory offers an intensive 10-week program focusing on genetic testing, data visualization, and peer review. A $7,000 stipend and housing are available.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and execute an independent research project
  • Analyze data and present findings
  • Participate in the residential life program

Requirements:

  • Graduating high school seniors
  • Must be at least 18 years old by move-in date
  • Demonstrated passion for science

What We Offer:

  • $7,000 Stipend
  • Room and board included
  • Focus on scientific communication
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires two letters of recommendation, transcripts, and a resume.

opportunities.title: Stanford Institutes of Medicine Summer Research Program (SIMR)
opportunities.description: Networking opportunity on the Stanford campus. Basics of medical research under mentorship.
opportunities.shortDescription: 8-week medical research program at Stanford University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
If medical research sparks your interest, the SIMR program will introduce you to its basics under the mentorship of Stanford researchers. Stipends are available; admissions favor Bay Area students.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct hands-on research in a specific institute (e.g., Cancer Biology, Immunology)
  • Attend safety training and lectures
  • Present a research poster at the end of the program

Requirements:

  • Juniors and seniors aged 16+
  • U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents
  • Preference for local Bay Area students

What We Offer:

  • Stipend (needs-based options available)
  • Direct mentorship from Stanford faculty
  • Exposure to careers in medicine
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application with essay questions. Requires transcript and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Anson L. Clark Scholar Program
opportunities.description: Open to students in both STEM and humanities. Free program with meals, room, and board included.
opportunities.shortDescription: Intensive research scholar program at Texas Tech University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every summer, 12 highly motivated high schoolers take part in this free program (meals, room, and board included). You can choose from eight research areas, from physics to history.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete a research project in chosen field
  • Attend weekly seminars and field trips
  • Submit a final research report

Requirements:

  • Students graduating in 2026 or 2027
  • Aged 17+ by program start date
  • Highly competitive academic record

What We Offer:

  • $750 tax-free stipend
  • Room and board provided
  • Broad range of research fields (STEM & Humanities)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online. Includes essays, academic transcripts, and up to three letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: High School Research Program (HSRP)
opportunities.description: Opportunity to participate in transformative science and technology research at Brookhaven National Lab.
opportunities.shortDescription: 6-week commuter research program at Brookhaven National Laboratory.
opportunities.fullDescription:
If you aspire to pursue STEM studies, the Brookhaven National Laboratory’s free commuter program is for you. The organization recommends applying if you’ve completed 11th grade.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with scientific staff on projects
  • Attend educational workshops
  • Commute daily to the laboratory (housing not provided)

Requirements:

  • Aged 16+
  • Completion of 11th grade recommended
  • U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident status usually required

What We Offer:

  • Access to national laboratory facilities
  • Transformative research experience
  • Networking with professional scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via the BNL Office of Educational Programs system. Requires transcript and recommendations.

opportunities.title: High School Summer Research Experience in Cancer (SURE-CAN)
opportunities.description: Solid introduction to the basics of cancer sciences. Intern in 'dry' or 'wet' lab research.
opportunities.shortDescription: Cancer research internship at Roswell Park for Western NY students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Roswell Park, a cancer center, welcomes students motivated to intern in ‘dry’ or ‘wet’ lab research. The SURE-CAN program is free, with limited need-based financial aid available.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research in cancer science
  • Participate in professional development seminars
  • Present a final poster

Requirements:

  • Enrolled in junior year (rising senior)
  • Aged 15+
  • Must be a resident of Western New York

What We Offer:

  • Insight into cancer research
  • Options for wet (lab) or dry (data) research
  • Need-based financial aid
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Students must rank their top areas of scientific interest.

opportunities.title: JCVI Internship Program
opportunities.description: Opportunity to earn while doing research. Paid internship at J. Craig Venter Institute.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid genomics and bioinformatics internship at JCVI.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Yes, it’s not just a biomedical research opportunity; it’s a paid internship that will earn you $17.50/hour. Most internship options take place in the summer, but some year-round opportunities are available.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform assigned research tasks in genomics or bioinformatics
  • Attend intern development activities
  • Collaborate with mentors on scientific projects

Requirements:

  • Aged 16+
  • Eligible to work in the U.S.
  • Strong interest in biological sciences

What We Offer:

  • Paid position ($17.50/hour)
  • Real-world lab experience
  • Locations in CA and MD
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via the JCVI careers page. Requires a resume and cover letter tailored to the specific internship opening.

opportunities.title: Memorial Sloan Kettering Summer Student Program
opportunities.description: Focus on self-directed projects. Biomedical and computational lab-based internship.
opportunities.shortDescription: 8-week cancer research internship at MSK for local students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Another cancer center on our list, Memorial Sloan Kettering, organizes a biomedical and computational lab-based internship for high schoolers every summer. Participants receive a $1,200 stipend.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on independent research projects
  • Attend extracurricular events and tours
  • Prepare a final presentation

Requirements:

  • Enrolled in junior year
  • Aged 14+
  • Residing within 25 miles of the campus (Commuter only)

What We Offer:

  • $1,200 stipend
  • World-class cancer research environment
  • Mentorship from MSK faculty
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including short essays, transcript, and two letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: Broad Summer Scholars Program
opportunities.description: Interesting social events and ample learning opportunities. No previous research experience required.
opportunities.shortDescription: 6-week genomics research program at Broad Institute.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Broad Institute’s free summer program is for high schoolers interested in science. Excitement is a must; research experience is not. A $3,600 stipend and partial travel cost reimbursement are available.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct original research in a lab
  • Attend career panels and scientific talks
  • Present research at a final poster session

Requirements:

  • Rising juniors and seniors
  • Interest in genomics and biomedicine
  • Available for the full 6 weeks

What We Offer:

  • $3,600 stipend
  • No prior experience required
  • Partial travel reimbursement
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring short essay responses and contact information for a reference.

opportunities.title: Next Generation STEM Internship Program (NGSI)
opportunities.description: Multiple opportunities for professional development. Focuses on energy and environmental research.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid internship at Oak Ridge National Laboratory.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Oak Ridge National Laboratory offers multiple paid internship sessions: you can apply for summer, fall, and spring cohorts. The laboratory itself focuses on energy and environmental research.

Responsibilities:

  • Support research projects in energy and environment
  • Participate in professional development workshops
  • Network with laboratory staff

Requirements:

  • Rising juniors/seniors or recent graduates
  • Aged 16+
  • U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Residency typically required

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Access to a DOE National Laboratory
  • Professional development opportunities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online via the Zintellect system (ORISE). Requires a resume and academic records.

opportunities.title: ACS Project SEED
opportunities.description: Opportunities available across the country. Pursue research across 40 U.S. states.
opportunities.shortDescription: Summer research program for economically disadvantaged students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Every year, more than 350 students interested in chemistry get the opportunity to pursue research across 40 U.S. states and territories. Participation in the SEED program also makes you eligible for its college scholarships.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct chemistry-related research for 8-10 weeks
  • Work under the supervision of a scientist mentor
  • Participate in safety training

Requirements:

  • High school students with interest in chemistry
  • Economically disadvantaged family background (financial criteria apply)
  • U.S. based

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • College scholarship eligibility
  • Mentorship in chemistry careers
opportunities.applicationProcess: Students apply online. The application requires financial documentation to prove eligibility and academic transcripts.

opportunities.title: Lumiere Research Scholar Program
opportunities.description: founded by Harvard & Oxford researchers. 1-on-1 mentorship to write an independent research paper.
opportunities.shortDescription: Remote, 1-on-1 research mentorship program with PhD scholars.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Founded by Harvard & Oxford researchers, the Lumiere Research Scholar Program is a rigorous research program tailored for high school students. The program pairs high-school students with PhD mentors to work 1-on-1 on an independent research project.

Responsibilities:

  • Meet one-on-one with a PhD mentor
  • Conduct independent research
  • Write a full research paper

Requirements:

  • High academic achievement (typically 3.3+ GPA)
  • Enrolled in high school
  • Access to a computer and internet for remote work

What We Offer:

  • 1-on-1 mentorship
  • Flexible schedule (Summer/Fall/Winter/Spring)
  • Financial aid available
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application involves a written form and an interview. Highly selective.

opportunities.title: SPARK Summer Mentorship Program
opportunities.description: Pairs high-achieving students with industry experts to conduct research on customers and financial markets.
opportunities.shortDescription: Finance and business research mentorship in the Greater Seattle area.
opportunities.fullDescription:
SPARK is a summer mentorship program that pairs high-achieving and highly motivated high schoolers with industry experts, university professors, and mentors to conduct research on customers and financial markets.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in research projects related to finance/business
  • Work closely with assigned mentors
  • Commit to 8-10 weeks of participation

Requirements:

  • U.S. Citizens or Permanent Residents only
  • High motivation and academic achievement
  • Submission of project-specific essays

What We Offer:

  • Industry expert mentorship
  • Real-world market research experience
  • Networking opportunities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Students must apply to specific projects with tailored essays.

opportunities.title: Adler Planetarium Far Horizons Teens
opportunities.description: Capture data on light pollution and learn how to communicate research findings to the public.
opportunities.shortDescription: Astronomy and light pollution research internship in Chicago.
opportunities.fullDescription:
During this summer internship program, incoming 10th, 11th, and 12th graders will help staff at the Adler Planetarium capture data on light pollution and learn how to communicate research findings to the public.

Responsibilities:

  • Use special cameras to capture light pollution data
  • Analyze astronomy data
  • Communicate findings to the public
  • Attend evening sessions on Wednesdays

Requirements:

  • Incoming grades 10-12
  • Availability for day sessions and Wednesday nights
  • Interest in astronomy/science communication

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on work with astronomy equipment
  • Experience in a major planetarium
  • Skill building in data collection
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Includes questions about interest in science and availability.

opportunities.title: Brookfield Zoo King Conservation Science Scholars
opportunities.description: Interactive workshops, research, and community-based projects centered on zoology and conservation.
opportunities.shortDescription: Conservation and zoology program at Brookfield Zoo.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Interactive workshops, fun activities, research, and community-based projects are at the core of this exciting internship. It’s an excellent opportunity for students who love animals and also want to gain research skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Take foundation courses in conservation
  • Participate in community projects
  • Network with zoo professionals

Requirements:

  • High school students
  • Passion for animals and environment
  • Commitment to the program schedule

What We Offer:

  • College prep support
  • Scholarship opportunities after one year
  • Potential for paid positions
opportunities.applicationProcess: Rolling admission. Submit application via the zoo website.

opportunities.title: AMNH Science Research Mentoring Program (SRMP)
opportunities.description: Yearlong research project with Museum scientists. Paid opportunity ($2,500 stipend).
opportunities.shortDescription: 1-year paid research mentorship at the American Museum of Natural History.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The American Museum of Natural History’s Science Research Mentoring Program is an amazing opportunity for NYC high school students to conduct a yearlong research project with Museum scientists.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research for one academic year
  • Learn skills like coding (Python/R) or DNA analysis
  • Work with museum scientists

Requirements:

  • NYC high school student
  • Must complete prerequisite courses at AMNH Academy
  • Commitment to the full year

What We Offer:

  • $2,500 Stipend
  • Access to museum collections and labs
  • Mentorship from professional scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Requires completion of courses within the AMNH After School Program Science Research Academy to be eligible to apply.

opportunities.title: UChicago Data Science Institute Summer Lab
opportunities.description: Immersive eight-week paid summer research program. Paired with a data science mentor.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid data science research program at UChicago.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Data Science Institute Summer Lab Program is an immersive eight-week paid summer research program at the University of Chicago. High school students are paired with a data science mentor.

Responsibilities:

  • Work as a paid research assistant
  • Hone research methodology and coding skills
  • Create a final video presentation

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • No prior research experience required
  • Interest in applied data science

What We Offer:

  • Paid position
  • Mentorship in diverse fields (Biomedicine, CS, Policy)
  • End-of-summer symposium
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring a resume and personal statement.

opportunities.title: UT Austin High School Research Academy (HSRA)
opportunities.description: Interdisciplinary research projects in fields like biochemistry, genetics, and neuroscience.
opportunities.shortDescription: 5-week research program at UT Austin College of Natural Sciences.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Through UT Austin’s HSRA, high school students participate in interdisciplinary research projects being conducted by active College of Natural Sciences laboratories.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in lab research groups
  • Attend research seminars
  • Complete project deliverables

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Interest in natural sciences
  • Ability to commute or arrange housing (not provided)

What We Offer:

  • UT extension course credit
  • Experience in top-tier university labs
  • Exposure to diverse scientific fields
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Tuition fee applies.

opportunities.title: Max Planck Florida Institute Summer Research Internship
opportunities.description: Immersive laboratory experience in neuroscience. Focus on brain structure and imaging technologies.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid neuroscience internship in Jupiter, FL.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The MPFI Summer Research Internship offers rising juniors and seniors an immersive laboratory experience where they can learn from seasoned researchers. Focus areas include brain structure, function, and advanced imaging.

Responsibilities:

  • Work full-time in a neuroscience lab
  • Prepare a written scientific abstract
  • Deliver a final presentation

Requirements:

  • Rising junior or senior
  • Resident of Palm Beach or Martin County, FL
  • At least 16 years old

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship ($13/hour)
  • Advanced imaging training
  • Mentorship from MPFI scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including transcripts and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Lincoln Park Zoo Malott Family Zoo Intern Program
opportunities.description: Learn how to educate others about animal and conservation sciences. Paid 7-week program.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid zoo internship for Chicago residents.
opportunities.fullDescription:
During this paid seven-week program, high school students learn how to educate others about animal and conservation sciences while crafting digital messages to engage audiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Educate visitors about conservation
  • Meet with researchers and animal care staff
  • Create a final capstone project

Requirements:

  • Chicago resident
  • Aged 16-18 (grades 10-12)
  • Interest in animal science

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Career exploration in zoology
  • Skill building in public engagement
opportunities.applicationProcess: Submit online application. Interviews are conducted for finalists.

opportunities.title: The Scripps Research High School Internship Program
opportunities.description: Hands-on laboratory experience to expose students to careers in biological and chemical sciences.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid biomedical research internship in La Jolla, CA.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Scripps Research Institute’s La Jolla headquarters offers a seven-week hands-on research experience. It is designed to expose students to careers in biological and chemical sciences.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct hands-on lab experiments
  • Attend enrichment seminars
  • Present research findings

Requirements:

  • High school student in San Diego County
  • At least 16 years old
  • Emphasis on underrepresented students

What We Offer:

  • $4,840 Stipend
  • World-class lab access
  • College preparation support
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including personal statement and transcripts.

opportunities.title: STEM@GTRI High School Summer Internship
opportunities.description: Paid internship hosted in the Georgia Tech Research Institute laboratories. Work on piezoelectric systems, radar, or drones.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid engineering and tech internship at Georgia Tech.
opportunities.fullDescription:
High school students in Georgia who will be 16 years or older can participate in this paid, five-week internship hosted in the Georgia Tech Research Institute (GTRI) laboratories.

Responsibilities:

  • Work 24 hours/week on technical projects
  • Research topics like radar, drones, or sensors
  • Present results at summer's end

Requirements:

  • Georgia resident
  • Aged 16+
  • Strong interest in engineering/tech

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Real-world engineering problems
  • Mentorship from GTRI researchers
opportunities.applicationProcess: Competitive online application. Accepts 60-70 students annually.

opportunities.title: RISE Environmentor Internship
opportunities.description: Research experience for students near Rockaway Peninsula. Topics include marine life and water safety.
opportunities.shortDescription: Marine science research internship in Rockaway, NY.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Environmentor Internship offers a great opportunity for 9th through 11th graders who live or attend school near the Rockaway Peninsula to gain firsthand research experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct field research on shoreline topics
  • Participate in water safety/CPR training
  • Engage in kayaking and surfing

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-11
  • Live/school near Rockaway Peninsula
  • Interest in marine science

What We Offer:

  • Up to $1,200 Stipend
  • Community service hours
  • Outdoor field experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Priority given to local residents.

opportunities.title: Secondary Student Training Program (SSTP)
opportunities.description: Immersive residential research experience at University of Iowa. Choose from biology, engineering, and more.
opportunities.shortDescription: Residential research program at University of Iowa.
opportunities.fullDescription:
High schoolers in 10th and 11th grade can take part in an immersive research experience at the University of Iowa. Participants live on campus and work in university labs.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research in faculty labs
  • Create and present a research poster
  • Participate in campus life

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11
  • Strong academic record
  • Available for full residential program

What We Offer:

  • 3 semester hours of college credit
  • Access to university libraries/labs

opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring transcripts, essays, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: Young Scholars Summer STEMM Research Program
opportunities.description: Hands-on research experience in fields such as cancer immunology, AI, and quantum mechanics at UIUC.
opportunities.shortDescription: STEMM research program at UIUC for Midwest students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This program, offered by the prestigious Grainger College of Engineering at UIUC, allows students to gain hands-on research experience in fields such as cancer immunology, AI, physics, and electrical engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in active research projects
  • Attend seminars on college admissions
  • Learn scientific communication

Requirements:

  • Rising 10th-12th graders
  • Residents of IL, IN, KY, MI, MO, IA, WI
  • Interest in engineering/science

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on lab experience
  • College prep seminars
  • Exposure to cutting-edge fields (AI, Quantum)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via the Grainger College of Engineering website.

opportunities.title: Summer Science Program (SSP)
opportunities.description: Work in small teams on real research in astrophysics, biochemistry, or genomics at various universities.
opportunities.shortDescription: Highly prestigious residential research program in Astrophysics, Biochem, or Genomics.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Students in the SSP get the chance to work in small teams on a real research project and gain firsthand experience taking and analyzing data. Held at various host universities.

Responsibilities:

  • Collect and analyze original data
  • Work in teams of three
  • Write a final research report

Requirements:

  • High school juniors (and exceptional sophomores)
  • Aged 15-19
  • Completion of prerequisite math/science courses

What We Offer:

  • Residential experience
  • Network of prestigious alumni
  • Need-blind admissions with financial aid
opportunities.applicationProcess: Rigorous application process including standardized test scores (optional but recommended) and multiple essays.

opportunities.title: Fred Hutch Summer High School Internship Program
opportunities.description: Immerse yourself in cancer research. Full-time, paid internship with lab training.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid cancer research internship at Fred Hutch in Seattle.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This full-time, paid internship opportunity offers students a chance to immerse themselves in activities at the Fred Hutch Cancer Center. Includes two weeks of training followed by six weeks of research.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete lab safety training
  • Work on mentored research projects
  • Attend college and career workshops

Requirements:

  • 11th or 12th graders
  • Strong interest in science
  • Backgrounds underrepresented in biomedical science encouraged

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • World-class cancer center experience
  • Mentorship and social activities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Includes personal statement and teacher evaluations.

opportunities.title: MSK Human Oncology and Pathogenesis Program (HOPP)
opportunities.description: Conduct independent research projects while participating in extracurricular activities at MSK.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid summer research program at MSK in NYC.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Human Oncology and Pathogenesis Program (HOPP) at MSK hosts a Summer Student Program for students to conduct independent research projects. Participants work with a mentor who will act as a supervisor.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop independent research skills
  • Complete a research project aligning with mentor's work
  • Present at a final poster session

Requirements:

  • Current high school junior
  • 3.5 GPA in science subjects
  • Live within 25 miles of MSK (Manhattan)

What We Offer:

  • $1,200 Stipend
  • Mentorship from MSK scientists
  • Extracurricular activities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Submit two letters of recommendation and short essay responses.

opportunities.title: UCSB Research Mentorship Program (RMP)
opportunities.description: Pairs qualified high schoolers with professionals conducting interdisciplinary research. 6-week summer program.
opportunities.shortDescription: Competitive research mentorship at UC Santa Barbara.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The University of California, Santa Barbara’s summer research mentorship program pairs qualified high schoolers with professionals conducting interdisciplinary research. Students will learn about research techniques and career options while clarifying their academic goals.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct university-level research
  • Attend the GRIT talks lecture series
  • Present findings at a research symposium

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11 (Rising Juniors/Seniors)
  • Minimum 3.80 weighted GPA
  • Application essays and transcript

What We Offer:

  • University credit (8 units)
  • Deep mentorship
  • Residential or commuter options
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including essays, transcript, and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Aspiring Scholars Directed Research Program (ASDRP)
opportunities.description: Gives students the chance to participate in STEM research projects and even publish and present their work.
opportunities.shortDescription: Hands-on research and publication program in Fremont, CA.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Olive Children Foundation’s Aspiring Scholars Directed Research Program (ASDRP) gives students the chance to participate in STEM research projects under three broad departments: Biological/Life Sciences, Chemistry/Physics, and CS/Engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct hypothesis-driven research
  • Work with state-of-the-art instrumentation
  • Aim for publication in scientific journals

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Strong interest in STEM
  • Commitment to the research timeline

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship from skilled scientists
  • Publication opportunities
  • State-of-the-art lab facilities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring transcripts and interest essays.

opportunities.title: Fermilab PRISM
opportunities.description: Immerses students into advanced STEM topics like AI, particle physics, and quantum science.
opportunities.shortDescription: Physics and quantum science internship at Fermilab.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Fermilab’s Program for Research, Innovation, and STEM Mentorship (PRISM) is a month-long program that immerses students into advanced STEM topics, including artificial intelligence, particle physics, and quantum science.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in lab internships
  • Shadow scientists and engineers
  • Work on a final research project

Requirements:

  • High school seniors or recent graduates
  • Underrepresented groups in STEM encouraged
  • Illinois residency often required

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Exposure to cutting-edge physics
  • Mentorship from Fermilab experts
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Fermilab education portal.

opportunities.title: Quest Student Research Institute
opportunities.description: Focuses on computer science-related research. Explore how programming translates to real-world applications.
opportunities.shortDescription: Virtual computer science and data analysis research.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Quest’s Student Research Institute (SRI) focuses on computer science-related research. Students explore how programming can translate to real-world applications, like data analysis, cryptography, and medicine.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn research methodology
  • Analyze data using programming
  • Present final research projects

Requirements:

  • Sophomores, Juniors, Seniors
  • Reliable internet connection (Virtual)
  • Interest in CS applications

What We Offer:

  • Flexible virtual format
  • Real-world coding application
  • Research mentorship
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online via the Quest Institute website.

opportunities.title: Grainger Summer Engineering Camp
opportunities.description: Offers both residential and commuter summer camps in aerospace, city planning, and cybersecurity.
opportunities.shortDescription: Engineering camps at UIUC for various disciplines.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Grainger College of Engineering at UIUC offers camps for students in a variety of disciplines, including aerospace engineering, city planning, and cybersecurity. They even have an 'Explore Your Options' camp.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in hands-on engineering challenges
  • Attend faculty lectures
  • Work in teams on design projects

Requirements:

  • Rising 7th graders through Seniors
  • Interest in engineering/math
  • Application required

What We Offer:

  • Experience at a top engineering school
  • Residential or commuter options
  • Exposure to diverse engineering fields
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Some tracks are lottery-based, others are competitive.

opportunities.title: Penn Biomedical Research Academy
opportunities.description: Focuses on how biological research can be used to treat diseases. Three-week residential experience.
opportunities.shortDescription: Intensive biomedical academy at UPenn.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The University of Pennsylvania’s Biomedical Research Academy focuses on how biological research can be used to treat diseases. This three-week residential experience gives high schoolers the chance to experience an Ivy League education.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend daily lectures and labs
  • Participate in journal clubs
  • Complete a group research project

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-11
  • Completed 1 year of HS Biology
  • Strong academic record

What We Offer:

  • Ivy League campus experience
  • Access to Penn medical labs
  • College credit available
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including essays, transcript, and letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: Penn Chemistry Research Academy
opportunities.description: Focuses on how chemistry can solve real-world problems. Hands-on laboratory experience.
opportunities.shortDescription: Chemistry research program at UPenn.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Chemistry Research Academy focuses on how chemistry can solve real-world problems. About half of the academy focuses on hands-on laboratory experience, complemented by lectures and field trips.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform experiments in university labs
  • Learn analytical techniques
  • Explore industrial applications of chemistry

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-11
  • Completed 1 year of HS Chemistry
  • Passion for physical sciences

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on lab training
  • Guidance from Penn faculty
  • Philadelphia field trips
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Penn Summer Global Institute.

opportunities.title: Penn Experimental Physics Research Academy
opportunities.description: Introduces students to the principles of physics including astrophysics and quantum dynamics.
opportunities.shortDescription: Physics research academy at UPenn.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Experimental Physics Research Academy introduces students to the principles of physics and how they can be used in a variety of industries, including astrophysics and quantum dynamics. No prior physics experience is required.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in inquiry-based learning
  • Visit research centers
  • Work on physics projects

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-11
  • Strong math background helpful
  • Curiosity about how the universe works

What We Offer:

  • Access to Penn physics labs
  • Exposure to modern physics topics
  • Residential experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Penn Summer Global Institute.

opportunities.title: Penn Neuroscience Research Academy
opportunities.description: Explores how the brain’s biology informs cognitive functions like emotion, memory, and morality.
opportunities.shortDescription: Neuroscience academy at UPenn.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Neuroscience Research Academy explores how the brain’s biology informs cognitive functions like emotion, memory, and morality. This academy is taught by members of Penn’s Biological Basis of Behavior program.

Responsibilities:

  • Study neurobiology and behavior
  • Participate in lab demos
  • Engage in ethics discussions

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-11
  • Completed 1 year Biology and 1 year Chemistry
  • Strong academic standing

What We Offer:

  • Insight into the biological basis of behavior
  • Mentorship from Penn students/faculty
  • Immersion in neuroscience research
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Penn Summer Global Institute.

opportunities.title: Penn Social Justice Research Academy
opportunities.description: Explore the complex, interdisciplinary issues at the core of social justice, including history, politics, and culture.
opportunities.shortDescription: Social science and justice research program at UPenn.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Penn’s Social Justice Research Academy encourages students from diverse backgrounds to explore the complex, interdisciplinary issues at the core of social justice. Students conduct research exploring both past struggles and modern issues.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct qualitative/quantitative research
  • Attend guest lectures

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-11
  • Interest in sociology, history, or politics

What We Offer:

  • Interdisciplinary research skills
  • Capstone project experience

opportunities.description: Explore biomedicine, specializing in research at either the cellular or molecular level.

The University of Cincinnati College of Medicine’s summer institute offers a variety of research sessions for students to explore biomedicine. Each session offers hands-on experience in a state-of-the-art laboratory.

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on lab experience
  • Exposure to medical school environment
  • Guidance from research pros
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring teacher recommendation and personal statement.

opportunities.title: Stanford GRIPS Program
opportunities.description: Genomics Research Internship Program (GRIPS) is an eight-week genetics research intensive.
opportunities.shortDescription: Genomics research internship at Stanford for Bay Area students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Stanford’s Genomics Research Internship Program (GRIPS) is an eight-week genetics research intensive designed for Bay Area high school students. Program participants are immersed into a strong community that prioritizes scientific study.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct computational or wet-lab research

  • Present research findings

Requirements:

  • Sophomores, Juniors, Seniors

What We Offer:

  • Stipend (need-based)

opportunities.title: UCSF Summer Student Research Program

opportunities.fullDescription:
The UCSF Summer Student Research Program connects high schoolers with mentors in the healthcare field, including providers and researchers, to conduct meaningful medical research. Includes workshops and seminars.

  • Conduct research with a faculty mentor
  • Attend professional development workshops

  • Juniors and Seniors
  • Interest in health sciences

What We Offer:

  • Exposure to top-tier medical research

opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring resume, transcript, and personal statement.

The Future Scientist Program at Indiana University’s Simon Comprehensive Cancer Center is designed to expose local public school students to scientific careers. Participants work directly with a professional mentor to conduct cancer research.

  • Work in a cancer research lab
  • Attend weekly educational sessions
  • Present research poster

  • Juniors from Marion County Public Schools
  • GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Strong science interest

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Direct mentorship

Northwestern’s Kimberly Querrey Summer Research Program is a highly competitive, paid program focusing on lung disease. Selected students receive one-on-one mentorship as they conduct biological research.

  • Conduct research on lung biology/disease

  • Participate in lab meetings

Requirements:

  • Rising Seniors (current Juniors)
  • Minimum 3.5 GPA
  • Interest in biomedical careers

What We Offer:

  • Hourly wage provided
  • Mentorship from top lung researchers

  • Conduct research in a UConn lab
  • Attend seminars on health disparities
  • Present final research findings

  • Current Juniors
  • Strong academic background
  • Interest in health professions

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Exposure to dental/medical schools
  • Research skill development
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application involves essays, transcripts, and two letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: Coriell Summer Experience

  • Rotate through various lab departments
  • Learn cell culture and DNA banking

  • Sophomores, Juniors, Seniors
  • Age 17+ preferred

What We Offer:

  • Certificate of completion
  • Hands-on biotech experience

opportunities.description: Four-week intensive focusing on cellular biology, molecular biology, and microbiology techniques.

  • Learn advanced lab techniques
  • Conduct independent projects
  • Analyze experimental data

Requirements:

  • Sophomores and Juniors
  • Completed one year of high school biology

What We Offer:

  • University credit
  • Residential experience
  • Rigorous lab training
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including transcripts, essays, and teacher recommendation.

  • Sophomores and Juniors
  • GPA of 3.5 or higher
  • Resident of Southwest PA

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Specialized women's health focus

opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Competitive selection.

This full-time, five-week summer program is designed to introduce young scientists to laboratory research techniques. Students join a real laboratory team, and they end the summer by presenting their findings.

  • Work in a biomedical research lab
  • Attend faculty lectures
  • Present research poster

Requirements:

  • Sophomores, Juniors, Seniors
  • Age 16+
  • NYC residents preferred

What We Offer:

  • Introduction to medical research
  • Mentorship from Einstein faculty
  • Certificate of completion
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including personal statement and letters of recommendation.

  • Attend lectures and labs
  • Design an original research project
  • Present findings

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Interest in medicine

What We Offer:

  • College-level curriculum
  • Locations in CA, London, and Virtual

  • Learn tissue engineering concepts

  • Sophomores, Juniors, Seniors
  • GPA of 3.0+ recommended

  • Hands-on UCSD lab access
  • Mentorship from grad students

This program combines resources from the University of California, San Diego and the Boz Institute to expose high schoolers to a broad range of biological research techniques. Includes field work and lectures.

  • Immersion in life sciences
  • College credit options

  • Grades 9-12

  • Hands-on skills training

  • Grades 9-12

  • Entrepreneurial toolkit

opportunities.fullDescription:
Louisiana State University’s summer research program brings together high school, college, and medical school students for eight weeks. Students spend their time doing hands-on work alongside professional mentors.

  • Work 40 hours/week in a lab
  • Attend career seminars
  • Create a research poster

Requirements:

  • Juniors and Seniors
  • GPA of 3.5+
  • Interest in health careers

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Medical school exposure
  • Research mentorship

opportunities.title: Aspirnaut High School Internships

  • Grades 9-12

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided

What We Offer:

  • Work on AFRL research projects
  • Participate in STEM outreach
  • Present findings

Requirements:

  • Sophomores to Seniors
  • U.S. Citizenship
  • Interest in aerospace/STEM

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Clearance possibilities
  • Cutting-edge aerospace tech
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via the AFRL Scholars website.

opportunities.title: Headwaters Science Institute Research
opportunities.description: 5-day intensive to create research projects about California’s diverse ecosystems.
opportunities.shortDescription: Short-term ecology research program in California.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Headwaters Science Institute’s 5-day intensive gives high schoolers the chance to create their own research projects about California’s diverse ecosystems. Encourages local exploration.

Responsibilities:

  • Formulate a research question
  • Collect field data
  • Analyze and present results

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Ability to travel to field site
  • Interest in nature

What We Offer:

  • Field research skills
  • Mentorship from ecologists
  • Publication in student journal
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online registration via Headwaters website.

opportunities.title: MIT PRIMES
opportunities.description: Year-long research program for high school students in mathematics, CS, and computational biology.
opportunities.shortDescription: Selective research program at MIT (Local & National tracks).
opportunities.fullDescription:
MIT PRIMES (Program for Research in Mathematics, Engineering, and Science) is a year-long research program. It includes PRIMES-USA (a nationwide distance mentoring program for math) and the local Boston section for Math/CS/Bio.

Responsibilities:

  • Solve challenging research problems
  • Work with MIT mentors
  • Write a final research paper

Requirements:

  • Strong background in Math/CS
  • Entrance exam (Problem Set)
  • Time commitment of 10+ hours/week

What We Offer:

  • Publication opportunities
  • Presentations at MIT conferences
  • World-class mentorship
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application involves solving a rigorous problem set and submitting letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: Garcia Summer Scholars Program
opportunities.description: Specializes in materials science and engineering. Offers mentorship in university-level lab environments at Stony Brook.
opportunities.shortDescription: Intensive materials science program at Stony Brook University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Garcia Center for Polymers at Engineered Interfaces offers a 7-week intensive program. Students work in teams with faculty and grad students on forefront materials science research.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct polymer/materials research
  • Prepare results for national competitions
  • Attend scientific seminars

Requirements:

  • High school students (aged 16+)
  • GPA of 3.8+ (unweighted)
  • SAT/ACT scores usually required

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on engineering experience
  • History of producing STS/ISEF winners
  • College-level lab access
opportunities.applicationProcess: Mail-in application (rare for modern programs) including transcript, essays, and 3 recommendations.

opportunities.title: Regeneron Science Talent Search (STS)
opportunities.description: The most prestigious science competition for U.S. high school seniors conducting original scientific research.
opportunities.shortDescription: The 'Junior Nobel Prize' competition for HS seniors.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Often referred to as the 'Junior Nobel Prize,' the Regeneron STS is the nation's oldest and most prestigious science and math competition for high school seniors.

Responsibilities:

  • Submit a full research paper
  • Provide certification of original work
  • Finalists present in Washington D.C.

Requirements:

  • High school seniors living in the U.S.
  • Original, independent research project
  • Completed before application deadline

What We Offer:

  • Up to $250,000 top prize
  • Network of top young scientists
  • National recognition
opportunities.applicationProcess: Comprehensive online application requiring a full research paper, transcripts, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: Regeneron International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF)
opportunities.description: The world’s largest international pre-college science competition. Qualify through local fairs.
opportunities.shortDescription: Global science fair championship.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Regeneron ISEF is the world’s largest international pre-college science competition. Students cannot apply directly; they must qualify by winning a top prize at an affiliated local or regional science fair.

Responsibilities:

  • Present research at a local fair
  • Win advancement to ISEF
  • Present to international judges

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Original research project
  • Qualification via affiliated fair

What We Offer:

  • Millions in scholarships/prizes
  • Global networking
  • Travel to the host city
opportunities.applicationProcess: Win a local affiliated fair to qualify. Check the 'Find a Fair' tool on the Society for Science website.

opportunities.title: Junior Science and Humanities Symposium (JSHS)
opportunities.description: Sponsored by the U.S. Military, encouraging students to engage in STEM research and compete.
opportunities.shortDescription: DoD-sponsored regional and national research symposia.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Sponsored by the U.S. Army, Navy, and Air Force, JSHS encourages high school students to engage in STEM research and compete at regional and national levels for scholarships.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct original research
  • Present findings orally or via poster
  • Compete at regional symposium

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Submission of abstract/paper

What We Offer:

  • Undergraduate tuition scholarships
  • Travel to National JSHS
  • Exposure to DoD research
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply to your specific regional symposium (deadlines typically Jan-Feb).

opportunities.title: Conrad Challenge
opportunities.description: Combines STEM research with entrepreneurship. Pitch innovative solutions to global problems.
opportunities.shortDescription: Innovation and entrepreneurship competition.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Conrad Challenge combines STEM innovation with entrepreneurship. Student teams develop and pitch innovative solutions to global problems in categories like aerospace, energy, and cyber-technology.

Responsibilities:

  • Form a team of 2-5 students
  • Develop an innovation portfolio
  • Pitch to judges (investor style)

Requirements:

  • Aged 13-18
  • Team-based participation
  • Original product/service idea

What We Offer:

  • Scholarships and seed funding opportunities
  • Business skill development
  • Global exposure
opportunities.applicationProcess: Team registration online followed by submission of the Innovation Brief.

opportunities.title: American Junior Academy of Science (AJAS)
opportunities.description: A unique national meeting where high school students present research alongside professional scientists.
opportunities.shortDescription: Honorary research society and annual conference.
opportunities.fullDescription:
AJAS is a unique national meeting where high school students present their research alongside professional scientists at the annual AAAS conference. You must be inducted via a state academy of science.

Responsibilities:

  • Present research poster
  • Attend AAAS scientific sessions
  • Network with top scientists

Requirements:

  • Nomination by state science academy
  • Top placement in state research/fair

What We Offer:

  • Publication in AJAS proceedings
  • Breakfast with Nobel Laureates
  • Induction as a lifetime Fellow
opportunities.applicationProcess: Qualify through your local State Junior Academy of Science.

opportunities.title: Nova Research Program
opportunities.description: Matches students with expert mentors from top universities to develop a formal, publication-ready research paper.
opportunities.shortDescription: 1-on-1 research mentorship program (2.5-5 months).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Nova Research matches students with expert mentors from institutions such as Harvard, MIT, and Stanford. Students explore a topic of interest and develop a formal, publication-ready research paper.

Responsibilities:

  • Weekly 1-on-1 mentorship sessions
  • Develop literature review and methodology
  • Produce polished research paper

Requirements:

  • Middle or High School student
  • High academic motivation
  • Commitment to 2.5-5 months

What We Offer:

  • Publication support
  • Personalized learning plan
  • Expert faculty mentorship
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application involves a consultation and matching process.

opportunities.title: Nova Patent Program
opportunities.description: Project-based experience centered on real-world problem-solving and invention prototyping.
opportunities.shortDescription: Invention and patent filing mentorship (2-4 months).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Guided by mentors with expertise in engineering and AI, students design, prototype, and document an original invention with potential for a provisional patent application.

Responsibilities:

  • Brainstorm and analyze product feasibility
  • Create CAD models or prototypes
  • Prepare provisional patent documents

Requirements:

  • Interest in entrepreneurship/design
  • Drive to invent
  • Commitment to 2-4 months

What We Offer:

  • Guidance on patent filing
  • Technical mentorship (CAD/AI)
  • Innovation portfolio
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application and consultation.

opportunities.title: Google Science Fair
opportunities.description: A global online competition that invites students to submit original scientific projects for recognition.
opportunities.shortDescription: Global online science competition.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Google Science Fair is a global online competition open to students from around the world. It encourages youth to change the world through scientific inquiry and engineering. (Note: Check official site for relaunch dates).

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct an in-depth investigation
  • Submit a digital project site
  • Finalists present at Google HQ

Requirements:

  • Ages 13-18
  • Individual or small team
  • Internet access

What We Offer:

  • Educational scholarships
  • Mentorship opportunities
  • Global platform for ideas
opportunities.applicationProcess: Submission via the official Google Science Fair website.

opportunities.title: Zooniverse
opportunities.description: Citizen science platform allowing students to contribute to large-scale data collection and analysis.
opportunities.shortDescription: Virtual citizen science research platform.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Zooniverse is the world’s largest and most popular platform for people-powered research. This research is made possible by volunteers — more than a million people around the world who come together to assist professional researchers.

Responsibilities:

  • Classify data (images, audio, etc.)
  • Contribute to real scientific datasets
  • Engage in community discussion boards

Requirements:

  • Computer/Tablet with internet
  • No prior expertise required
  • Open to all ages

What We Offer:

  • Contribution to real papers
  • Flexible time commitment
  • Wide variety of topics (Space, Nature, Humanities)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Sign up for free on the website and start classifying immediately.

opportunities.title: Science Buddies
opportunities.description: Comprehensive resource for generating ideas, forming hypotheses, and following step-by-step procedures.
opportunities.shortDescription: Project guide and STEM resource platform.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Science Buddies is a comprehensive resource for students. It features a Topic Selection Wizard to help find project ideas, guides on the scientific method, and 'Ask an Expert' forums.

Responsibilities:

  • Use tools to find research topics
  • Follow guides for experimental design
  • Utilize resources for science fairs

Requirements:

  • Open to all K-12 students
  • Self-directed learning

What We Offer:

  • Free project ideas
  • Expert advice
  • Teacher resources
opportunities.applicationProcess: Open access website. No application required.

opportunities.title: Harvard Secondary School Program (SSP)
opportunities.description: Offers summer courses and limited research opportunities for high schoolers.
opportunities.shortDescription: 7-week academic summer program at Harvard.
opportunities.fullDescription:
While direct lab placement is rare for high schoolers, the Harvard Secondary School Program offers college-credit courses, some of which are research-intensive or lab-based. It provides a true college experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete college-level coursework
  • Participate in seminars
  • Utilize Harvard libraries

Requirements:

  • Graduating in 2025, 2026, or 2027
  • Strong academic record
  • Age 16-19

What We Offer:

  • Harvard college credit
  • Residential or online options
  • Global student community
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Harvard Summer School including counselor report and transcript.

opportunities.title: Lumiere Research Inclusion Foundation
opportunities.description: Non-profit research program for gifted students from low-income backgrounds. Fully funded.
opportunities.shortDescription: Zero-cost, 1-on-1 research mentorship for low-income students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Lumiere Research Inclusion Foundation is a non-profit research program for gifted students from low-income backgrounds. Stemming from the Lumiere Research Scholar Program, the foundation provides the same access to independent research experiences at zero cost.

Responsibilities:

  • Work 1-on-1 with a Ph.D. mentor
  • Conduct an independent research project
  • Produce a research paper

Requirements:

  • High level of academic achievement
  • Demonstrated financial need
  • Enrolled in high school

What We Offer:

  • Fully funded (Free)
  • World-class mentorship
  • Remote participation
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via the Lumiere Foundation website.

opportunities.title: Heithoff-Brody High School Scholars (Salk Institute)
opportunities.description: 8-week paid internship at the Salk Institute. Participate in advanced research projects with scientists.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid STEM internship at the Salk Institute in San Diego.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Heithoff-Brody High School Scholars Program is an 8-week, paid internship designed to help you explore different STEM fields. At the Salk Institute, you'll participate in advanced research projects with scientists.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn laboratory techniques
  • Work 30-40 hours per week
  • Collaborate on real research projects

Requirements:

  • San Diego County resident
  • Completed 1 year of HS Chem and Bio
  • Age 16+

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Mentorship from top scientists
  • Critical thinking skill development
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including transcripts and essays.

opportunities.title: Horizon Academic Research Program
opportunities.description: Trimester-long research programs. Create a 20-page, university-level research paper.
opportunities.shortDescription: Virtual research mentorship producing publication-ready papers.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Horizon offers trimester-long research programs for high school students. You’ll be paired with a professor or Ph.D. scholar to create a 20-page, university-level research paper that you can send to prestigious journals.

Responsibilities:

  • Select a subject track (Data Science, Bio, etc.)
  • Work with a university mentor
  • Write a publication-ready paper

Requirements:

  • GPA > 3.67/4.0
  • Mostly 10th/11th graders
  • Apply 4 weeks in advance

What We Offer:

  • Letter of recommendation
  • Detailed project feedback
  • Financial aid available
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application involves track selection and academic review.

opportunities.title: Johns Hopkins Internship in Brain Science (JHIBS)
opportunities.description: Research program to promote inclusivity in neurological sciences. Virtual and in-person options.
opportunities.shortDescription: Neuroscience internship at Johns Hopkins (Project Pipeline).
opportunities.fullDescription:
This 5-week virtual (or 8-week in-person) research program is for high school students from underrepresented communities to promote inclusivity in neurological sciences.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research under leading neuroscientists
  • Attend scientific seminars
  • Present research orally or via poster

Requirements:

  • Juniors and Seniors
  • Underrepresented groups preferred
  • In-person requires Baltimore residency

What We Offer:

  • Stipend ($500 virtual / varies in-person)
  • Mentorship from JHU faculty
  • Career development sessions
opportunities.applicationProcess: Annual application deadline of March 1st.

opportunities.title: The Mary Miller Summer Program (PHC Group)
opportunities.description: Interns work on social media, community projects, and marketing research. Remote paid internship.
opportunities.shortDescription: Remote public health and marketing internship.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This is a prestigious internship opportunity for rising high school juniors and seniors with the PHC Group. Interns will get the chance to build leadership skills and pursue independent interests.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on social media/community projects
  • Conduct marketing research
  • Collaborate remotely

Requirements:

  • Juniors and Seniors
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Strong work ethic

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Leadership skill building
  • Remote flexibility
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply as soon as possible via PHC Group website.

opportunities.title: Northwestern CTD Summer Camp
opportunities.description: Delve into pre-professional instruction under the guidance of industry leaders. 100% need-based aid available.
opportunities.shortDescription: Summer academic camp at Northwestern University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Northwestern University's Center for Talent Development's Summer Camp is designed to provide students with research experiences under the guidance of university faculty mentors.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in intensive coursework
  • Grapple with complex problems
  • Explore advanced concepts

Requirements:

  • High School Students
  • Academic motivation
  • Application required

What We Offer:

  • Research experience
  • 100% need-based financial aid
  • University environment
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Northwestern CTD.

opportunities.title: EnergyMag Research Internship
opportunities.description: Ideal for students interested in renewable energy and energy storage. Research emerging technologies.
opportunities.shortDescription: Remote renewable energy research internship.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This internship program is ideal for students interested in renewable energy and energy storage. Interns will engage in activities such as researching emerging technologies and analyzing market trends.

Responsibilities:

  • Research energy technologies
  • Analyze market trends
  • Contribute to published articles

Requirements:

  • Sophomores to Seniors
  • GPA 3.25+ in honors science/English
  • Self-motivated

What We Offer:

  • Flexible schedule (Half/Quarter time)
  • Remote work
  • Publication opportunities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Applications open year-round online.

opportunities.title: Science and Engineering Apprenticeship Program (SEAP)
opportunities.description: Work in Department of Navy laboratories. 300 placements across over 38 laboratories nationwide.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid research apprenticeship at US Navy labs.
opportunities.fullDescription:
SEAP is a prestigious apprenticeship program that gives high school students the chance to work in Department of Navy laboratories. You will work with top researchers and engineers on actual Naval research.

Responsibilities:

  • Work hands-on in Navy labs
  • Assist with engineering/science projects
  • Complete 8-week summer session

Requirements:

  • High school student (Grade 9 completed)
  • U.S. Citizen
  • Age 16+

What We Offer:

  • $4,000 stipend (new participants)
  • Mentorship from Navy scientists
  • Real-world defense research
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via SEAP website. Selection based on lab interest.

opportunities.title: CMU Summer Academy for Math and Science (SAMS)
opportunities.description: Free summer program for underrepresented backgrounds. Earn college credit at Carnegie Mellon.
opportunities.shortDescription: Free STEM academy at Carnegie Mellon University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
SAMS is one of the free summer programs for high school students from underrepresented backgrounds who want to earn college credit. Students engage in a rigorous curriculum taught by CMU faculty.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend daily classes and labs
  • Complete a research project
  • Participate in academic development

Requirements:

  • Sophomores or Juniors
  • Underrepresented background
  • Strong interest in STEM

What We Offer:

  • Free tuition/program
  • College credit
  • CMU faculty mentorship
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including essays and transcripts.

opportunities.title: Seattle Children’s Research Institute Virtual Training
opportunities.description: Become familiar with research and global health. Includes workshops on college readiness.
opportunities.shortDescription: Virtual/Hybrid global health research training.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This free summer program allows high school students to become familiar with research, gain hands-on experience, and increase their knowledge of global health. The program has both online and in-person components.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in research workshops
  • Learn about global health issues
  • Engage in career exploration

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Open to U.S. and International

What We Offer:

  • Free program
  • Hands-on experience
  • College readiness training
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Seattle Children's website.

opportunities.title: NIDA Recruitment & Training for Under-Represented Populations (RTURP)
opportunities.description: Interested in the scientific basis of drug abuse. Learn research practice as part of the Intramural Research Program.
opportunities.shortDescription: Drug abuse research program for underrepresented students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The RTURP is one of the premier free summer programs for high school students who are interested in the scientific basis of drug abuse. The program prioritizes students from under-represented communities.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend research classes
  • Learn research practices
  • Work at Johns Hopkins Bayview Campus

Requirements:

  • Age 17+
  • Underrepresented background
  • High school or college student

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on training
  • Exposure to NIDA research
  • Free program
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online via the NIDA IRP website.

opportunities.title: UC Irvine Math ExpLR
opportunities.description: Focused on mathematical biology. Collaborate on a computational biology research project.
opportunities.shortDescription: Mathematical biology research program at UC Irvine.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Math ExpLR is focused on mathematical biology. In this program, students will be paired with undergraduates and collaborate on a computational biology research project with a principal investigator.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on computational bio projects
  • Attend skill development workshops
  • Learn mathematical writing

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Interest in math and biology

What We Offer:

  • Free program
  • Undergraduate mentorship
  • Skill development
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via UC Irvine Math Department.

opportunities.title: Stanford SHTEM
opportunities.description: Virtual opportunities to explore research in info science, engineering, arts, and biology.
opportunities.shortDescription: Virtual multidisciplinary (STEM+Humanities) research at Stanford.
opportunities.fullDescription:
SHTEM is a prestigious free online research program offering virtual opportunities to explore research. Projects cover a broad spectrum including engineering, arts, linguistics, psychology, and biology.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct virtual research
  • Collaborate with Stanford mentors
  • Engage in interdisciplinary study

Requirements:

  • Grades 11-12 (or Community College)
  • Interest in STEM and Humanities
  • Availability for full summer

What We Offer:

  • Free program
  • Mentorship from Stanford Compression Forum
  • Exposure to diverse fields
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application closes in January.

opportunities.title: APA Internships
opportunities.description: Diverse roles in research, policy, and more at the American Psychological Association.
opportunities.shortDescription: Psychology research and policy internships.
opportunities.fullDescription:
