APA internships offer diverse roles in research, policy, and more. As an intern, you may participate in research, writing, and web-based projects and assist staff with administrative tasks.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist with research and writing
  • Support administrative tasks
  • Attend workshops

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Interest in psychology
  • Research skills

What We Offer:

  • Practical psychology experience
  • In-person (DC) or Remote
  • Professional development
opportunities.applicationProcess: Rolling applications via APA careers portal.

opportunities.title: NIH HiSTEP
opportunities.description: Internships in biomedical engineering and healthcare. Delve into the scope of the scientific enterprise.
opportunities.shortDescription: Biomedical training program at NIH for local students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Conducted by the National Institute of Health, HiSTEP offers internships in biomedical engineering and healthcare. You’ll learn about research careers through lectures, group visits, and networking.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend lectures and discussions
  • Participate in group projects
  • Complete resilience training

Requirements:

  • High school juniors
  • GPA 3.0+
  • Live within 40 miles of Bethesda, MD

What We Offer:

  • Stipend (~$2,300)
  • College application guidance
  • Exposure to NIH research
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via NIH training website.

opportunities.title: QuarkNet Summer Research Program
opportunities.description: Conduct research alongside scientists at Fermilab. Focus areas include particle physics and quantum science.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid particle physics research at Fermilab.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Under the aegis of the U.S. DOE, the QuarkNet program at Fermilab allows students to conduct research alongside scientists. Focus areas generally include particle physics, quantum science, and accelerators.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyze particle physics data
  • Develop research abstracts
  • Present oral reports

Requirements:

  • Sophomores to Seniors
  • Attend Illinois high school
  • U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident

What We Offer:

  • Paid ($17.20/hour)
  • Real-world physics research
  • Mentorship from Fermilab scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application opening in November.

opportunities.title: Immerse Education
opportunities.description: Specialises in educational experiences for students with their sights set on Oxbridge and Ivy League colleges.
opportunities.shortDescription: Online and residential research programmes with Oxbridge/Ivy League tutors.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Immerse Education specialises in educational experiences for students with their sights set on Oxbridge and Ivy League colleges. The Oxbridge and Ivy League Online Research Programme sees students receive tuition from an Oxbridge or Ivy League tutor.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in 1:1 or small group tuition
  • Complete a university-level research project
  • Explore subjects like Medicine, Law, AI, and History

Requirements:

  • Aged 13-18
  • High academic motivation
  • English proficiency

What We Offer:

  • Tuition from top university tutors
  • 8 UCAS points (Accredited programs)
  • Personalized feedback
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online enrollment. Early deadlines typically in March/April.

opportunities.title: Cambridge Future Scholar Program (CCIR)
opportunities.description: Taught by current teachers at Cambridge, Oxford, MIT, and Stanford. Small groups of 2-5 students.
opportunities.shortDescription: 13-week research mentorship with Cambridge/Oxford faculty.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Run by the Cambridge Centre for International Research (CCIR), the Future Scholar Program is for small groups of students. It is taught by current teachers at the University of Cambridge, Oxford, MIT, and others.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend small group sessions (2-5 students)
  • Conduct independent research over 13 weeks
  • Receive a letter of recommendation

Requirements:

  • Aged 16-18
  • Strong academic record
  • Interview required

What We Offer:

  • Faculty mentorship
  • Publication guidance
  • Letter of recommendation
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application followed by an interview.

opportunities.title: Indigo Research High School Program
opportunities.description: Pairs students one-on-one with professors from top universities. 100% flexible schedule.
opportunities.shortDescription: Flexible 1-on-1 research mentorship with top professors.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Indigo Research pairs students one-on-one with professors from top universities in both the US and the UK. Students embark on their own research projects with 100% flexibility in scheduling.

Responsibilities:

  • Design a research project with a mentor
  • Meet regularly for guidance
  • Produce a final paper or project

Requirements:

  • Aged 13-18
  • Passion for a specific subject
  • Self-discipline for independent work

What We Offer:

  • 1-on-1 mentorship
  • Flexible start dates
  • College application support
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online consultation and application.

opportunities.title: BETA Camp
opportunities.description: Unique four-week course helps you to plan and launch a real business. Styled on an MBA.
opportunities.shortDescription: Virtual entrepreneurship and business incubation camp.
opportunities.fullDescription:
For students interested in business, BETA Camp is the perfect online course. This unique four-week course helps you to plan and launch a real business, styled on an MBA curriculum.

Responsibilities:

  • Build a real startup
  • Attend workshops on marketing and finance
  • Pitch to investors

Requirements:

  • Aged 13-18
  • Interest in entrepreneurship
  • Commitment to 4-week intensive

What We Offer:

  • Networking with industry pros (Google, Airbnb)
  • Real business launch experience
  • Skill building in sales and product
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Cohorts run Seasonally (Winter/Summer).

opportunities.title: Polygence
opportunities.description: Expert mentorship offering Core Program (10-week deep dive) and Pods (6-week group).
opportunities.shortDescription: Online research mentorship platform (1-on-1 or Groups).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Polygence offers mentorship programs for high school students. The Core Program is a 10-week deep dive into a topic of your choice with one-on-one mentorship, culminating in a showcase.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with a mentor on a custom project
  • Write a paper or create a creative project
  • Present at the Polygence symposium

Requirements:

  • Aged 13-18
  • Curiosity and drive
  • Submission by 15th of month for next cohort

What We Offer:

  • Personalized mentorship
  • Publication support
  • College credit options (UCI)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Rolling admissions.

opportunities.title: Brown University Leadership Institute
opportunities.description: Connects students in small groups to discuss complex social issues and devise solutions.
opportunities.shortDescription: Social justice and leadership program at Brown University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Brown University has a pre-college program specifically for students passionate about social justice. The Leadership Institute connects students in small groups to discuss complex social issues and devise solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in workshops on leadership
  • Develop an Action Plan for social change
  • Collaborate with diverse peers

Requirements:

  • Ages 14-18 (Grades 9-12)
  • Interest in social justice
  • English proficiency

What We Offer:

  • Brown University certificate
  • Leadership skill development
  • Action-oriented curriculum
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Brown Pre-College portal.

opportunities.title: Veritas AI Fellowship
opportunities.description: Teaches students collaborative learning and project development through one-on-one mentorship in AI.
opportunities.shortDescription: AI research fellowship and mentorship program.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Veritas AI hosts a research program for students passionate about artificial intelligence. The AI Fellowship teaches students collaborative learning and project development through one-on-one mentorship.

Responsibilities:

  • Build an independent AI model/project
  • Work with mentors from top universities
  • Combine AI with other fields (finance, med, etc.)

Requirements:

  • Aged 13-18
  • Basic Python knowledge (or take Scholars track first)
  • Commitment to 12-15 weeks

What We Offer:

  • Expert AI mentorship
  • Publication support
  • Real-world technical skills
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application.

opportunities.title: Emory University Pre-College Program
opportunities.description: Offers over 100 courses taught by experts. Non-credit and credit-bearing options available.
opportunities.shortDescription: Pre-college academic program at Emory University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Emory University College of Arts and Sciences offers a program for students interested in a variety of fields. Students can take non-credit courses (2-4 weeks) or credit courses (6 weeks) with undergraduates.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend university-level classes
  • Participate in campus life activities
  • Complete course assignments/exams

Requirements:

  • Aged 15-18
  • Strong academic record (3.0+ GPA)
  • Rising Juniors and Seniors

What We Offer:

  • College credits (transferable)
  • Experience at a top research university
  • Diverse course catalog
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Priority deadlines typically in early Spring.

opportunities.title: JHU APL ASPIRE Program
opportunities.description: Work at the Applied Physics Lab to explore STEM careers. Access technical and professional resources.
opportunities.shortDescription: Applied Physics internship at Johns Hopkins (Hybrid/Virtual options).
opportunities.fullDescription:
High school juniors and seniors work at the applied physics lab at Johns Hopkins to experience and explore STEM careers before committing to a major in college.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on projects in Aerospace, Bio, CS, or Cybersecurity
  • Collaborate with APL mentors
  • Participate in summer or academic year sessions

Requirements:

  • Grades 11-12
  • Age 15+
  • Reside within commuting distance (or 50 miles for virtual)

What We Offer:

  • Free program
  • 1-in-5 acceptance rate (~20%)
  • Real-world lab access
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via JHU APL STEM website.

opportunities.title: Inspirit AI Scholars Program
opportunities.description: Empowers high school students to apply artificial intelligence to disciplines like healthcare, finance, and art.
opportunities.shortDescription: Project-based AI program with mentors from Stanford/MIT.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The AI Scholars Program at Inspirit AI is a unique offering that empowers high school students to apply artificial intelligence and computer science to their work across disciplines.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn AI and Machine Learning fundamentals
  • Complete a socially-impactful research project
  • Work with mentors from top universities

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Interest in CS/AI
  • Computer with internet access

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship from Stanford/MIT grads
  • Project-based learning
  • Interdisciplinary applications
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Rolling admissions.

opportunities.title: UT Welch Summer Scholar Program
opportunities.description: Hands-on, college-level projects using state-of-the-art equipment at various Texas universities.
opportunities.shortDescription: Chemistry research program at Texas universities (UT Austin, etc.).
opportunities.fullDescription:
The WSSP has provided nearly 2,000 Texas high school students with opportunities to participate in hands-on, college-level projects using state-of-the-art equipment.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct chemical research
  • Work in university labs (UT Austin, Dallas, Houston, etc.)
  • Use advanced technology

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11
  • Student in Texas
  • Nomination usually required

What We Offer:

  • Free program
  • College-level experience
  • Network of Texas researchers
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via WSSP portal.

opportunities.title: Goddard Space Flight Center Internship
opportunities.description: Participate in engineering research and experiential learning near Hubble and James Webb operations.
opportunities.shortDescription: NASA internship at Goddard (Greenbelt, MD).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Just outside Washington DC, the Goddard Space Flight Center is home to Hubble operations and a proving ground for the James Webb Space Telescope. NASA internships here leverage unique missions.

Responsibilities:

  • Support NASA engineering/science missions
  • Work with a NASA mentor
  • Gain experiential learning

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • U.S. Citizenship
  • GPA 3.0+

What We Offer:

  • Exposure to space flight operations
  • Mentorship from NASA engineers
  • Stipend provided
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via NASA STEM Gateway.

opportunities.title: Cooper Union STEM Scholars Internship
opportunities.description: College-level courses on machine learning, racecar research, and biomaterials design.
opportunities.shortDescription: Intensive STEM internship at Cooper Union for NYC students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Summer STEM at the Cooper Union offers high schoolers the chance to take college-level courses. The STEM Scholars Internship is specifically for sophomores and juniors.

Responsibilities:

  • Take courses in Engineering Design, ML, or Biomaterials
  • Participate in design challenges
  • Collaborate with engineering faculty

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11 (for internship track)
  • NYC student
  • Application required

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on engineering projects
  • Accepts ~260 students (20-24 per class)
  • College-level curriculum
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application opening in January.

opportunities.title: Fermilab TARGET Program
opportunities.description: Highly competitive six-week summer internship for Illinois high schoolers with aptitude in math/CS/engineering.
opportunities.shortDescription: STEM diversity internship at Fermilab (Illinois only).
opportunities.fullDescription:
TARGET is a highly competitive six-week summer internship opportunity for Illinois high school sophomores and juniors with a strong interest in math, computer science, and/or engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on Fermilab projects
  • Engage in experiential learning
  • Combine work with education

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11
  • Illinois student
  • Underrepresented groups encouraged

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Select cohort (15-25 interns)
  • Hands-on physics/engineering work
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Fermilab website.

opportunities.title: UNH-IOL HighTech Bound
opportunities.description: Paid four to six-week summer internship experiencing network technologies and real-world tech.
opportunities.shortDescription: Network engineering internship at UNH Interoperability Lab.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The flagship high school program at the UNH-IOL, HighTech Bound is a paid summer internship. Students experience network technologies from companies like Apple, Dell, and Cisco.

Responsibilities:

  • Test network technologies
  • Work with real-world software projects
  • Prepare for engineering careers

Requirements:

  • Rising 12th graders
  • Interest in network engineering

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay
  • Industry-standard equipment
  • Real-world QA experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via UNH-IOL website.

opportunities.title: Rochester LLE Summer Research Program
opportunities.description: Work 40-hour weeks at a national investigative center for intense radiation and matter.
opportunities.shortDescription: Laser energetics research internship at University of Rochester.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The LLE’s annual summer research program provides an exceptional opportunity for highly motivated high schoolers to experience scientific research in a realistic environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Work 40 hours/week on a research project
  • Supervised by staff scientists
  • Present findings

Requirements:

  • Rising 12th graders
  • Rochester-area student
  • U.S. Citizenship/PR usually required

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay
  • Access to Omega Laser Facility
  • Real scientific publication potential
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application deadline in March. Requires transcript and recommendations.

opportunities.title: Sandia National Laboratories Pre-College Internship
opportunities.description: Work on challenging projects at competitive pay. Summer, year-round, and co-op options.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid STEM internship at Sandia National Labs.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Internships at Sandia come in three varieties: summer, year-round, and co-op. All internships provide opportunities to work on challenging projects with mentoring from top scientists.

Responsibilities:

  • Support national security research
  • Work with state-of-the-art equipment
  • Gain practical work experience

Requirements:

  • Age 16+
  • Full-time student
  • GPA 3.0+

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay
  • Academic credit (Co-op)
  • Mentorship from engineers
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online via Sandia Careers portal.

opportunities.title: AEOP High School Apprenticeship
opportunities.description: Spend time in Army Research Laboratories learning from professional engineers. Locations nationwide.
opportunities.shortDescription: Army Research Lab apprenticeship with stipend.
opportunities.fullDescription:
In AEOP, high school students aspiring to be engineers spend their time in one of several Army Research Laboratories learning from professional engineers and participating in their research.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in lab research
  • Work with Army engineers
  • Attend mentorship sessions

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Interest in STEM
  • U.S. Citizenship usually required

What We Offer:

  • $2,000-$3,000 stipend
  • Mentorship
  • Networking with peers
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via AEOP website.

opportunities.title: Princeton Laboratory Learning Program
opportunities.description: Full-time, free research experience in science or engineering. Supervised by Princeton faculty.
opportunities.shortDescription: Research internship at Princeton University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Laboratory Learning Program at Princeton University is a full-time, free research experience. Students participate in ongoing research projects closely supervised by Princeton faculty.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct full-time research
  • Work in Princeton labs
  • Follow customized schedule

Requirements:

  • Aged 16-18 by June 15
  • Highly motivated
  • No cost to attend

What We Offer:

  • Ivy League research experience
  • Faculty supervision
  • Free program
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Highly selective.

opportunities.title: UT Austin My Introduction to Engineering (MITE)
opportunities.description: Five-day camp for current high school juniors to discover engineering through team projects.
opportunities.shortDescription: Engineering camp at UT Austin for diversity/inclusion.
opportunities.fullDescription:
MITE is a five-day camp for current high school juniors to discover engineering through participation in an engineering team project and interactions with engineering students and faculty.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete engineering team project
  • Live in campus dorms
  • Interact with alumni

Requirements:

  • Grade 11
  • Strong interest in engineering
  • Commitment to diversity

What We Offer:

  • Campus residential experience
  • ~20% acceptance rate
  • Insight into UT engineering
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application with $80 fee.

opportunities.title: Penn Engineering Summer Academy (ESAP)
opportunities.description: Intensive, three-week program combining sophisticated theory with hands-on practical experience.
opportunities.shortDescription: Rigorous engineering academy at UPenn.
opportunities.fullDescription:
ESAP’s intensive, three-week program welcomes highly motivated students to explore college-level engineering. Combines theory with hands-on experience in fields like Robotics or Biotech.

Responsibilities:

  • Take college-level engineering courses
  • Complete hands-on lab work
  • Earn college credit

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-11
  • Age 15+
  • High aptitude for math/science

What We Offer:

  • UPenn course credit
  • Ivy League faculty interaction
  • Selective cohort (35 per class)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring essays and transcripts.

opportunities.title: Columbia SHAPE
opportunities.description: Summer High School Academic Program for Engineers. Take college-level courses in robotics, biomed, etc.
opportunities.shortDescription: Engineering academic program at Columbia University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
In SHAPE, high school students choose a subject and participate in one introductory college-level engineering course. Topics include Robotics, Biomedical Engineering, and Chemical Engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend college-level engineering classes
  • Complete project-based coursework
  • Engage with Columbia faculty

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Strong academic record
  • Interest in engineering

What We Offer:

  • Columbia University experience
  • Rigorous academic curriculum
  • Project-based learning
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Priority deadline in January.

opportunities.title: SLAC Youth Opportunity Program (YOP)
opportunities.description: Ten-week employment program for local entry-level students from low-income backgrounds.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid internship at SLAC for low-income Bay Area students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
YOP at SLAC is a ten-week employment program designed to give local entry-level students from low-income backgrounds exposure to the workplace in science and engineering fields.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in administrative or technical roles
  • Gain workplace skills
  • Network with SLAC professionals

Requirements:

  • Age 18+ (Graduating Seniors)
  • Low-income/First-Gen background
  • Bay Area resident

What We Offer:

  • Paid employment
  • Workplace training
  • Exposure to National Lab environment
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply through partner organizations like Students Rising Above.

opportunities.title: California State Summer School for Mathematics and Science (COSMOS)
opportunities.description: Four-week residential summer program hosted at UC campuses (Davis, Irvine, San Diego, Santa Cruz).
opportunities.shortDescription: Intensive STEM residential program at University of California campuses.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Designed by the UC schools, COSMOS is a four-week residential summer program invested in the continuing education of high school students with demonstrated interest and achievement in math and science.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in specialized STEM clusters
  • Live on a UC campus for 4 weeks
  • Engage in hands-on labs (e.g., engineering at UCSD)

Requirements:

  • Grades 8-12 (varies by campus)
  • California residents (limited out-of-state spots)
  • Academic excellence in math/science

What We Offer:

  • University faculty instruction
  • Residential experience
  • Advanced STEM curriculum
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires essays, grades, and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Columbia University Summer Immersion
opportunities.description: Offers 1-week and 3-week courses in machine learning, blockchain, and material science in NYC.
opportunities.shortDescription: Pre-college academic immersion at Columbia University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
In its summer immersion program, Columbia University offers both 1-week and 3-week courses. The 3-week program offers a residential option which allows high schoolers to live on campus and explore NYC.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend daily classes (e.g., Blockchain, AI)
  • Complete course projects
  • Experience college life in NYC

Requirements:

  • Grades 9-12
  • Strong academic record
  • English proficiency

What We Offer:

  • Columbia certificate of participation
  • Instructor evaluations
  • Residential or commuter options
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application with transcripts and letters of recommendation.

opportunities.title: Summer@Brown
opportunities.description: Variety of online and in-person courses in CS, engineering, and biotechnology.
opportunities.shortDescription: Flexible pre-college courses at Brown University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Brown University offers a variety of online and in-person courses. Topics include 'Antibiotic Drug Discovery,' 'Coding to Read and Control the Brain,' and 'Data Science and Machine Learning.'

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in college-level study
  • Participate in campus activities
  • Complete course assessments

Requirements:

  • Completing grades 9-12
  • Aged 14-18

What We Offer:

  • Ivy League environment
  • Wide course selection
  • Global student community
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Rolling admissions.

opportunities.title: Summer Engineering Exploration (SEE) Camp
opportunities.description: Hosted by the Society of Women Engineers at UMich. One-week co-ed camp with design challenges.
opportunities.shortDescription: Engineering camp at University of Michigan.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Hosted by the Society of Women Engineers at the University of Michigan, SEE camp is a one-week, co-ed camp for high school students. Includes a week-long design challenge and campus tours.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete engineering design challenges
  • Tour engineering facilities
  • Participate in team building

Requirements:

  • Entering grades 10-12
  • Interest in engineering

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on engineering activities
  • Mentorship from SWE members
  • Exposure to UMich campus
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via UMich SWE website.

opportunities.title: MITES at MIT
opportunities.description: Rigorous six-week residential summer program. Introduces promising minority seniors to engineering and science.
opportunities.shortDescription: Free, intensive STEM program for underrepresented seniors at MIT.
opportunities.fullDescription:
MITES (Minority Introduction to Engineering and Science) is a rigorous six-week residential summer program at MIT. It stresses the value of pursuing technical degrees and careers.

Responsibilities:

  • Take 5 rigorous STEM courses
  • Complete a genomics research project
  • Attend Broad Institute lectures

Requirements:

  • Rising high school seniors
  • Underrepresented/underserved background
  • Strong academic record

What We Offer:

  • Free program
  • MIT residential experience
  • Deep alumni network
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including essays, tax forms, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: ESTEEM / SER-Quest
opportunities.description: Recruits talented high school students to Maryland’s A. James Clark School of Engineering.
opportunities.shortDescription: Engineering research program at University of Maryland.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The goal of the ESTEEM/SER-Quest program at the University of Maryland is to recruit talented high school students. Participants develop a research proposal and conduct a project.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop a research proposal
  • Conduct an engineering project
  • Learn college application process

Requirements:

  • Rising Seniors
  • Interest in engineering

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship from UMD students
  • Literature review training
  • Networking with engineering faculty
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via UMD Engineering website.

opportunities.title: Johns Hopkins Engineering Innovation
opportunities.description: College-level course for motivated students. Options in general engineering, biomedical, or sustainable energy.
opportunities.shortDescription: College-credit engineering program at Johns Hopkins.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Johns Hopkins Whiting School of Engineering offers three programs: Explore Engineering Innovation, Biomedical Engineering Innovation, and Sustainable Energy Engineering. Offered in-person and online.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete lab activities (bridge building, spaghetti structures)
  • Learn engineering theory
  • Take final exams for credit

Requirements:

  • High school students
  • Completed Algebra II/Trig and Physics/Chem
  • As and Bs in math/science

What We Offer:

  • JHU college credit
  • Hands-on curriculum
  • Residential or commuter options
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring transcript, teacher recommendation, and essay.

opportunities.title: Notre Dame Introduction to Engineering (IEP)
opportunities.description: Two-week program including career overviews, engineering design, and computer programming.
opportunities.shortDescription: Pre-college engineering program at Notre Dame.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Between their junior and senior years, high school students are encouraged to experience Notre Dame’s two-week program. Includes updates on career opportunities and engineering design.

Responsibilities:

  • Study engineering design
  • Learn computer programming basics
  • Meet professional engineers

Requirements:

  • Rising Seniors
  • Strong academic standing

What We Offer:

  • Notre Dame campus experience
  • Career exploration
  • Faculty interaction
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Notre Dame Pre-College.

opportunities.title: CURIE Academy at Cornell
opportunities.description: One-week program for high school girls excelling in math and science. Focus on engineering.
opportunities.shortDescription: Engineering academy for girls at Cornell University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
CURIE Academy is a one-week program for high school girls excelling in math and science. It engages students in field sessions led by Cornell Engineering faculty and a week-long research project.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete a group research project
  • Attend engineering field sessions
  • Explore Cornell campus

Requirements:

  • Rising Juniors and Seniors
  • Female students
  • No prior engineering experience required

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship from female faculty
  • Research project experience
  • Insight into engineering majors
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including transcript and recommendation.

opportunities.title: MIT Women’s Technology Program (WTP)
opportunities.description: Four-week academic experience introducing girls to engineering through hands-on classes and labs.
opportunities.shortDescription: Introductory engineering/CS program for girls at MIT.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The MIT Women’s Technology Program is a four-week academic experience. It introduces students to engineering through hands-on classes, labs, and team-based projects in the summer after 11th grade.

Responsibilities:

  • Take classes in ME or EECS
  • Work on team-based projects
  • Complete hands-on labs

Requirements:

  • Rising Seniors (Female)
  • No prior background in engineering/CS
  • High math/science aptitude

What We Offer:

  • MIT residential experience
  • collaborative community
  • Focus on underrepresented students
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Highly competitive.

opportunities.title: Catalyst Academy at Cornell
opportunities.description: One-week residential program for underrepresented backgrounds in STEM. Demystifies college admissions.
opportunities.shortDescription: Diversity-focused engineering program at Cornell.
opportunities.fullDescription:
CATALYST is a one-week residential program at Cornell for rising high school juniors and seniors from traditionally underrepresented backgrounds. Highlights career and graduate school pathways.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in engineering workshops
  • Work on a group project
  • Attend admissions workshops

Requirements:

  • Rising Juniors and Seniors
  • Underrepresented background in STEM
  • GPA 3.0+

What We Offer:

  • College admissions prep
  • Engineering exposure
  • Cornell residential life
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application with transcript and recommendation.

opportunities.title: Stanford Pre-Collegiate Summer Institutes
opportunities.description: Browse classes in product design, biomedical engineering, data science, and AI.
opportunities.shortDescription: Online and residential academic enrichment at Stanford.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Explore Stanford’s course catalog for Grades 8-11. Classes cover product design, augmented reality, biomedical engineering, data science, cryptography, and artificial intelligence.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in synchronous online or in-person classes
  • Participate in discussions
  • Complete course projects

Requirements:

  • Grades 8-11
  • Academic motivation

What We Offer:

  • Top-tier instruction
  • Global peer network
  • Intellectual challenge
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring work samples and transcript.

opportunities.title: Yale Young Global Scholars (YYGS)
opportunities.description: Residential sessions with a concentration in 'Innovations in Science & Technology'.
opportunities.shortDescription: Global academic leadership program at Yale.
opportunities.fullDescription:
YYGS offers residential sessions with a concentration in 'Innovations in Science & Technology.' The IST specialization is designed for students interested in applying scientific principles to real-world applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend lectures and seminars
  • Work on a capstone project
  • Collaborate with global peers

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11
  • Age 16-18
  • International students welcome

What We Offer:

  • Yale campus experience
  • Diverse global community
  • Interdisciplinary curriculum
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including essays and teacher recommendation.

opportunities.title: MSU High School Honors Science Program (HSHSP)
opportunities.description: Oldest continuously running program of its kind. Seven-week summer research intensive.
opportunities.shortDescription: Intensive research program at Michigan State University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The oldest, continuously running program of its kind in the U.S., HSHSP is a seven-week summer research program designed for high school students who wish to gain more experience conducting research.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct full-time research
  • Live on MSU campus
  • Present findings

Requirements:

  • Rising Seniors (Grade 11)
  • Top academic standing
  • Passion for research

What We Offer:

  • Deep research immersion
  • Social context for knowledge
  • History of alumni success
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including two essays and two recommendations.

opportunities.title: Harvard Medical School Project Success
opportunities.description: Paid, mentored summer research internships for Boston/Cambridge students from underrepresented backgrounds.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid biomedical internship at Harvard Medical School for local students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Project Success: Opening the Door to Biomedical Careers is a program for Boston and Cambridge high school students, particularly underrepresented students, to participate in paid, mentored, summer research internships.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in Harvard research labs
  • Attend seminars and workshops
  • Participate in career counseling

Requirements:

  • Grades 11-12
  • Boston/Cambridge resident
  • Underrepresented background in medicine

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Mentorship from Harvard faculty
  • Site visits to hospitals
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application usually coordinated through local schools or the HMS diversity office.

opportunities.title: Red Cross Bay Area Leadership Development Center (LDC)
opportunities.description: Four-day conference providing opportunities for youth to cultivate core leadership skills.
opportunities.shortDescription: Leadership and disaster preparedness conference in California.
opportunities.fullDescription:
A four-day conference at Loma Mar’s Redwood Glen Camp & Conference Center, LDC provides opportunities for youth ages 13-18 to develop and cultivate core leadership skills and participate in workshops.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend disaster preparedness workshops
  • Engage in leadership simulations
  • Network with Red Cross youth

Requirements:

  • Aged 13-18
  • Interest in humanitarian service

What We Offer:

  • Leadership certification
  • Community service hours
  • Network building
opportunities.applicationProcess: Registration via the Red Cross Northern California Coastal Region website.

opportunities.title: NHGRI Summer Internship Program
opportunities.description: Immerses students in an environment devoted to understanding human genetic disease. Part of NIH SIP.
opportunities.shortDescription: Genetics research internship at NIH (Bethesda, MD).
opportunities.fullDescription:
This program immerses students in an environment devoted to better understanding the underlying causes of human genetic disease. High school students attend the NIH Summer Seminar Series.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct genetic research
  • Attend NIH seminars
  • Present at Poster Day

Requirements:

  • Age 17+ by program start
  • U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • High academic standing

What We Offer:

  • Monthly stipend
  • Access to National Human Genome Research Institute
  • Career development
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply through the NIH Summer Internship Program (SIP) portal.

opportunities.title: MCW Apprenticeship in Medicine (AIM)
opportunities.description: Provides students from diverse backgrounds the opportunity to stimulate interest in careers in medicine.
opportunities.shortDescription: Medical apprenticeship at Medical College of Wisconsin.
opportunities.fullDescription:
AIM provides carefully selected high school students from diverse backgrounds the opportunity to stimulate their interest in careers in medicine, biomedical research, and allied health.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in clinical simulations
  • Attend anatomy labs
  • Shadow medical professionals

Requirements:

  • High school students
  • Diverse/Underrepresented background
  • Milwaukee area residents preferred

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Mentorship from medical students
  • Hands-on medical exposure
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via MCW website.

opportunities.title: Georgetown Lombardi Summer Volunteer Program
opportunities.description: 8-week full-time independent research project under the guidance of a research scientist.
opportunities.shortDescription: Cancer research volunteer program at Georgetown University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
As an outreach initiative, this program puts students in touch with experts devoted to curing cancer. Students work full-time on independent research projects under the guidance of a scientist.

Responsibilities:

  • Work full-time for 8 weeks
  • Conduct independent cancer research
  • Analyze scientific data

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Strong interest in oncology
  • Local housing (not provided)

What We Offer:

  • World-class lab experience
  • Research mentorship
  • Volunteer service hours
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application including resume and cover letter.

opportunities.title: MD Anderson King Foundation High School Program
opportunities.description: Introduces Texas rising seniors to a research environment at the nation’s leading cancer center.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid cancer research internship at MD Anderson (Texas only).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Now in its 63rd year, this program introduces Texas rising seniors to a research environment. Up to seven students are selected to participate in the ten-week program.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in labs 5 days/week
  • Participate in elevator speech competitions
  • Present final abstract/poster

Requirements:

  • Texas resident
  • Rising Senior (Grade 11)
  • Distinguished academic record

What We Offer:

  • Stipend ($6,000+)
  • Experience at #1 Cancer Center
  • Seminars and activities
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via MD Anderson education portal.

opportunities.title: Washington University Young Scientist Program (YSP)
opportunities.description: Attracts historically excluded groups to scientific careers. Paid summer research internships.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid diversity-focused internship at WashU St. Louis.
opportunities.fullDescription:
YSP aims to attract historically excluded groups in science to scientific careers. Features paid summer research internships, hands-on scientific demonstrations, and field trips.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research in WashU labs
  • Attend scientific demos
  • Engage in personalized mentoring

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • St. Louis area resident
  • Underrepresented background

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Mentorship from graduate students
  • College prep support
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via YSP website.

opportunities.title: NHLBI Summer Internship
opportunities.description: Conduct research under award-winning scientists. Part of the NIH Summer Internship Program.
opportunities.shortDescription: Heart, Lung, and Blood research internship at NIH.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The NHLBI holds a summer internship for high school students 17 years or older to conduct research under award-winning scientists and principal investigators at the NIH.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct biomedical research
  • Attend professional development workshops
  • Present research findings

Requirements:

  • Age 17+
  • U.S. Citizen/Permanent Resident
  • Enrolled in high school

What We Offer:

  • Monthly stipend
  • Federal research experience
  • Networking with NIH scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via NIH SIP portal.

opportunities.title: Dana-Farber/Harvard CURE Program
opportunities.description: Introduces students to the world of cancer research through placement in real research settings.
opportunities.shortDescription: Cancer research training for underrepresented MA students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Massachusetts high school students are introduced to the world of cancer research through placement in real research settings. The stipended program encourages future careers in biosciences.

Responsibilities:

  • Work in cancer research labs
  • Learn scientific communication
  • Attend journal clubs

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Massachusetts resident
  • Underrepresented background

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Mentorship from Harvard/Dana-Farber faculty
  • Career guidance
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via DF/HCC website.

opportunities.title: Forsyth Institute Student Scholars
opportunities.description: Eight-week internship for Massachusetts high schoolers. Pairs students with Forsyth faculty researchers.
opportunities.shortDescription: Oral health and immunology research internship in Boston.
opportunities.fullDescription:
An eight-week internship for Massachusetts high schoolers, the student scholars program pairs students with Forsyth faculty researchers to learn basic laboratory techniques.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn lab techniques (microbiology/immunology)
  • Participate in mentor's research
  • Present findings at weekly meetings

Requirements:

  • Massachusetts high school student
  • Strong science interest

What We Offer:

  • Stipend provided
  • Focus on health disparities
  • Hands-on lab work
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requiring essay and recommendations.

opportunities.title: Stanford Cardiothoracic Surgical Internship
opportunities.description: Intensive course providing knowledge of cardiothoracic surgical anatomy and physiology.
opportunities.shortDescription: Surgical skills and anatomy internship at Stanford Medicine.
opportunities.fullDescription:
This summer internship is an intensive course for high school students considering careers in medicine. It provides knowledge of cardiothoracic surgical anatomy and surgical techniques.

Responsibilities:

  • Practice surgical knot tying
  • Dissect porcine hearts
  • Attend lectures by surgeons

Requirements:

  • Age 16+
  • Strong interest in surgery
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on surgical skills
  • Certificate of completion
  • Networking with surgeons
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application. Tuition-based program.

opportunities.title: TGen Helios Scholars
opportunities.description: Paid, eight-week summer internship program open to graduating seniors in Arizona.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid genomics research internship for Arizona seniors.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Helios Scholars at TGen is a paid, eight-week summer internship program open to graduating seniors in Arizona. Interns work full-time to unravel the genetic components of diseases.

Responsibilities:

  • Work full-time on research projects
  • Attend professional development seminars
  • Present a scientific poster

Requirements:

  • Graduating high school senior
  • Arizona resident
  • Eligible to work in the U.S.

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • State-of-the-art genomics experience
  • Mentorship from TGen scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via TGen website.

opportunities.title: Introductory College Level Experience in Microbiology (ICLEM)
opportunities.description: Paid summer science intensive for economically disadvantaged students to study biotechnology and biofuels.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid microbiology and biofuels research at DOE's JBEI (Bay Area).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Hosted by the Joint BioEnergy Institute (JBEI) of the U.S. Department of Energy, iCLEM is a paid summer science intensive for economically disadvantaged high school sophomores and juniors in Alameda, Contra Costa, and San Francisco Counties.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete an independent research project
  • Explore careers in biotech/biofuels
  • Prepare for the college application process

Requirements:

  • Grades 10-11
  • Economically disadvantaged/underrepresented background
  • Resident of eligible CA counties

What We Offer:

  • Paid stipend
  • Exposure to DOE research lab
  • College preparation
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via JBEI/BioTech Partners.

opportunities.title: Biotech Academy (Biotech Partners)
opportunities.description: 6-8 week paid summer internships focused on academic curriculum and hands-on lab training for biotech careers.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid hands-on biotechnology internships in the Bay Area.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Biotech Academy includes academic curriculum and hands-on lab training designed to give students the knowledge and skills necessary to gain access to careers in biotechnology. Students receive tutoring in science, resumé writing, and job interview workshops.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete hands-on lab training
  • Attend workshops with industry professionals
  • Eligible for Bioscience Career Institute enrollment

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Interest in biotechnology
  • Local resident of partner school areas

What We Offer:

  • Paid summer internship
  • Tutoring and professional development
  • Career pathway options
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via Biotech Partners or participating high schools.

opportunities.title: Wave Hill Youth Internships
opportunities.description: Paid internships focusing on community engagement, environmental stewardship, and education.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid environmental and ecological internships (Bronx, NY).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Wave Hill provides paid youth internship programs that prepare high school students for future studies and careers. Options include year-long 'arts, community and environmental stewards,' summer 'ecological restoration,' and 14-month 'woodland ecology research.'

Responsibilities:

  • Ecological restoration or research
  • Environmental education
  • Community engagement

Requirements:

  • High school students
  • Interest in urban ecology
  • Commitment to the duration of the program (varies)

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Research mentorship (14-month program)
  • Environmental job skills
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application via Wave Hill website. Deadlines vary by program track.

opportunities.title: Student Conservation Association (SCA) Youth Programs
opportunities.description: Hands-on conservation programs nationwide to build community, restore parks, and develop leadership skills.
opportunities.shortDescription: National network of youth conservation and service programs.
opportunities.fullDescription:
By joining an SCA crew, high school students can plug themselves into a nationwide network of young conservationists. Programs range from the community to national level, focusing on park restoration and leadership development.

Responsibilities:

  • Trail maintenance and park restoration
  • Leadership and teamwork development
  • Conservation work in various locations

Requirements:

  • High school students (age 15-19)
  • Commitment to environmental service

What We Offer:

  • Stipend or educational award
  • College credit potential (for some programs)
  • Networking with conservation professionals
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via SCA website.

opportunities.title: OHSU Volunteer Opportunities in Research
opportunities.description: Volunteer research opportunities in areas like pulmonary care, children’s healthcare, and cancer clinical trials.
opportunities.shortDescription: Biomedical research volunteer positions at OHSU (Oregon).
opportunities.fullDescription:
OHSU offers volunteer opportunities such as clinical research in pulmonary and critical care & sleep medicine, novel interventions in children’s healthcare, and solid tumor and hematological malignancies clinical trials.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist clinical research coordinators
  • Observe lab procedures (varies by position)
  • Contribute to biomedical discovery

Requirements:

  • High school student (minimum age 16)
  • Volunteer commitment

What We Offer:

  • Exposure to academic health center research
  • Networking with breakthrough scientists
  • Experience in clinical trials
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via OHSU Volunteer Services portal. Placement is competitive.

opportunities.title: USDA Student Intern Program
opportunities.description: Gains valuable professional experience as assistants in scientific, professional, technical, and/or administrative areas.
opportunities.shortDescription: Federal internship opportunities across USDA agencies.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Student employees with the USDA gain valuable professional experience. Internships can be paid or unpaid, giving students insight into future careers with USDA across 7 mission areas, 19 agencies, and 16 administrative offices.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist staff in scientific or technical areas
  • Learn administrative procedures
  • Network across federal agencies

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • U.S. Citizenship
  • Enrollment in a secondary school

What We Offer:

  • Paid or unpaid positions
  • Insight into federal careers
  • Potential conversion to permanent position (Pathways)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via USAJOBS.gov (search 'Pathways Student Intern').

opportunities.title: Brooklyn Botanic Garden Apprentice Program (GAP)
opportunities.description: Long-term program for teens to learn about agriculture, botany, and environmentalism over a nine-month commitment.
opportunities.shortDescription: Long-term botany and environmental science apprenticeship.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Garden Apprentice Program (GAP) is a great way for teens to learn about agriculture and the environment. Apprentices work their way up a four-tier program, developing job skills and facilitating lessons to teach children.

Responsibilities:

  • Nine-month commitment (Mar-Nov)
  • Facilitate lessons for children
  • Learn botany and environmentalism

Requirements:

  • Grades 8-12
  • Commitment to weekly schedule in Spring/Fall

What We Offer:

  • Job skills development
  • Paid experience
  • Deep exposure to botany
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires recommendations and interview.

opportunities.title: MATE Internships (Marine Advanced Technology Education)
opportunities.description: Internships preparing high school students for ocean occupations and marine technical education.
opportunities.shortDescription: Internships in marine technology and ocean careers.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The MATE Center is a national partnership working to improve marine technical education. Internships vary from locations such as Santa Catalina Island, CA and Wallops Island, VA to Key West, FL and South Bimini, Bahamas.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on marine technical projects
  • Gain hands-on ocean experience
  • Exposure to Remotely Operated Vehicles (ROVs)

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Interest in ocean science/technology

What We Offer:

  • Internships in diverse locations
  • Technical skill development
  • Pathways to ocean occupations
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via MATE Center website.

opportunities.title: Iowa State George Washington Carver Internship Program
opportunities.description: Promotes “science with practice” by exposing interns to research in Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS).
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid research internship in Agriculture and Life Sciences.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The George Washington Carver Summer Research Internship Program exposes interns to research opportunities under the direction of CALS research faculty. Disciplines include agronomy, animal science, molecular biology, and agricultural engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research under a faculty mentor
  • Bridge the gap between lack of access to technology/information
  • Engage in experiential learning

Requirements:

  • High school student (rising 11th-12th)
  • Interest in CALS disciplines
  • Underrepresented groups encouraged

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Research experience in diverse fields
  • Mentorship in 'Science with Practice'
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic record and essays.

opportunities.title: Cornell Boyce Thompson Institute (BTI) Internships
opportunities.description: Offers positions in plant science research and computational biology with no prior lab experience required.
opportunities.shortDescription: Plant science and computational biology research at Cornell.
opportunities.fullDescription:
BTI offers internship positions to students interested in plant science research and computational biology. Accepted students join an international community of scientists and attend seminars and workshops.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside mentors on a pre-determined 6-week project
  • Attend seminars and workshops
  • Engage with an international scientific community

Requirements:

  • High school student (must be 16+)
  • Interest in plant science
  • No prior lab experience needed

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Research mentorship
  • Exposure to computational biology
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires essay and teacher recommendations.

opportunities.title: Smithsonian Environmental Research Center (SERC) Citizen Science
opportunities.description: Actively involves citizen scientists in projects like the Chesapeake Bay Otter Alliance and Salt Marsh Census.
opportunities.shortDescription: Citizen science projects for environmental monitoring.
opportunities.fullDescription:
SERC seeks to actively involve citizen scientists in projects such as the Chesapeake Bay Otter Alliance, Chesapeake Bay Parasite Project, and River Herring Conservation. Participation is flexible and includes seasonal projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Collect data for ongoing research projects
  • Monitor wildlife or ecological conditions
  • Contribute to long-term environmental studies

Requirements:

  • General public (high school students welcome)
  • Commitment to data collection protocols

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on research experience
  • Contribution to Smithsonian science
  • Engagement with the Chesapeake Bay ecosystem
opportunities.applicationProcess: Enrollment and participation via SERC project websites.

opportunities.title: UC Davis Young Scholars Program (YSP)
opportunities.description: Residential research program exposing 40 students to original research in biological, agricultural, and natural sciences.
opportunities.shortDescription: 6-week residential research program at UC Davis.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The summer program at UC Davis is designed to expose approximately 40 high-achieving high school students to the world of original research. Participants work one-on-one with research faculty in state-of-the-art laboratories for six weeks.

Responsibilities:

  • Work one-on-one with a faculty mentor
  • Prepare a journal-quality paper and symposium presentation
  • Earn five units of university group study credit

Requirements:

  • High school students (age 16+)
  • High academic achievement
  • Residential attendance required

What We Offer:

  • Individualized research project
  • University credit
  • Residential campus experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic record, essays, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: UC Santa Barbara Research Mentorship Program (RMP)
opportunities.description: Students are paired with a graduate student, postdoc, or faculty for a 7-week research project across various disciplines.
opportunities.shortDescription: Mentored research program at UC Santa Barbara.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Students in the Research Mentorship Program are paired up with a graduate student, postdoc, or faculty and choose a research project from a large list of disciplines including biology, engineering, and astrophysics.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn research techniques over 7 weeks
  • Forge a deep relationship with a research mentor
  • Present final research findings

Requirements:

  • High school student (rising 11th-12th)
  • Strong academic history
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • Deep mentorship experience
  • Insight into professional research
  • Maturing of academic goals
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires essays, transcript, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: Roswell Park Summer Cancer Research Experience
opportunities.description: High school juniors conduct independent research and receive classroom instruction on cancer basics.
opportunities.shortDescription: Cancer research program with mentorship at Roswell Park.
opportunities.fullDescription:
High school juniors will receive classroom instruction on cancer basics, seminars with invited speakers, and professional development opportunities in addition to conducting an independent research project.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct an independent research project
  • Attend seminars (biostatistics, cancer genetics, etc.)
  • Professional development opportunities

Requirements:

  • High school Junior (Grade 11)
  • Interest in cancer research
  • Local housing (not provided)

What We Offer:

  • Exposure to leading cancer research institution
  • Hands-on lab experience
  • Research experience across multiple disciplines
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic history and preferred field of focus ranking.

opportunities.title: Idaho National Laboratory (INL) Internships
opportunities.description: Paid internship positions in science and engineering at a Department of Energy facility.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid DOE science and engineering internships (Idaho).
opportunities.fullDescription:
As a Department of Energy facility, INL offers a diverse array of paid internship positions to high school students. Internships include a nationally competitive wage based on the number of credits completed.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with INL scientists and engineers
  • Support DOE research priorities (e.g., nuclear energy)
  • Gain technical experience

Requirements:

  • High school student (must be 16+)
  • U.S. Citizenship

What We Offer:

  • Nationally competitive wage
  • Exposure to major DOE national lab
  • Experience in nuclear and energy science
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online via the INL Careers portal.

opportunities.title: Hofstra University Summer Science Research Program (HUSSRP)
opportunities.description: Work with Hofstra science faculty in an on-campus research program, culminating in a fall poster session.
opportunities.shortDescription: On-campus science research program at Hofstra University.
opportunities.fullDescription:
HUSSRP provides selected research-oriented high school students the opportunity to work with Hofstra science faculty during the summer. The program culminates in a poster session in the fall where students display their summer research.

Responsibilities:

  • Work one-on-one with faculty mentors
  • Design and conduct scientific research
  • Present research at a fall poster session

Requirements:

  • Research-oriented high school student
  • Strong academic qualifications

What We Offer:

  • Faculty mentorship
  • Hands-on lab experience
  • Formal presentation opportunity
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application based on academic qualifications and mentor availability in area of interest.

opportunities.title: Exploratorium High School Explainers
opportunities.description: The Exploratorium’s youngest employees who engage visitors at exhibits, lead demonstrations, and run museum operations.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid work-based learning in science communication.
opportunities.fullDescription:
High School Explainers are a diverse group of students who fill over 130 paid positions a year. This work-based learning program is a first-time work experience for many, focusing on engaging visitors with exhibits.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage visitors at interactive exhibits
  • Lead demonstrations of scientific principles
  • Assist with museum operations

Requirements:

  • High school student (must be 15+)
  • Interest in science and public engagement

What We Offer:

  • Paid position
  • Science communication skill development
  • Team-based work experience
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via Exploratorium job portal.

opportunities.title: Monell Science Apprenticeship Program
opportunities.description: Paid full-time structured research activity focused on biomedical science, particularly for underrepresented groups.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid taste and smell biomedical research apprenticeship.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Monell Center’s mission is to stimulate an interest in biomedical science, particularly in groups typically underrepresented in science. The program includes at least seven weeks of paid full-time research.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct structured research with a Monell scientist
  • Present research at a public conference
  • Attend enrichment activities (ethics, public speaking)

Requirements:

  • High school student (rising 11th-12th)
  • Underrepresented group in science

What We Offer:

  • Paid full-time stipend
  • Focus on unique senses research (taste/smell)
  • Public presentation opportunity
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic background and essays.

opportunities.title: Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) High School Internship
opportunities.description: Qualified northern New Mexico high school seniors gain work experience and conduct research in theoretical biology or biosecurity.
opportunities.shortDescription: DOE research internship in theoretical biology/biosecurity.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Qualified northern New Mexico high school seniors are invited to participate in this program to conduct research in either theoretical biology and biophysics or biosecurity and public health.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop epidemiological models of disease transmission (Theoretical Biology)
  • Participate in experimental biology projects (Biosecurity)
  • Gain work experience at a National Lab

Requirements:

  • High school senior
  • Northern New Mexico resident
  • U.S. Citizenship

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship
  • Exposure to high-level biophysics research
  • Mentorship from LANL scientists
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via LANL job portal.

opportunities.title: Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) Internships
opportunities.description: Academic year and summer research internships providing mentorship from PNNL scientists and engineers.
opportunities.shortDescription: DOE research internships in WA state (Academic/Summer).
opportunities.fullDescription:
PNNL offers internships during the academic year and summer. High school research interns receive mentorship in a laboratory setting from PNNL scientists and engineers. Includes the Summer Research Apprenticeship and Young Women in Science programs.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct laboratory research (10 weeks in summer)
  • Receive mentorship in a lab setting
  • Opportunity to earn elective credits

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Interest in STEM fields
  • U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Resident

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay (for summer programs)
  • Mentorship at a DOE National Lab
  • Academic credit (via school program)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply via PNNL job portal; some programs require school-based application.

opportunities.title: Google Computer Science Summer Institute (CSSI)
opportunities.description: Online, four-week introduction to computer science for graduated seniors, targeted toward historically marginalized groups.
opportunities.shortDescription: Online CS introduction program by Google for graduated seniors.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Run by the industry leader, CSSI is an online, four-week introduction to computer science for graduated seniors looking to explore career opportunities in programming. The curriculum emphasizes fundamentals and encourages participation in workshops promoting self-care, identity, career development, and community building.

Responsibilities:

  • Learn computer science fundamentals
  • Participate in career development workshops
  • Network with Google industry professionals

Requirements:

  • High school graduate (rising college freshman)
  • Interest in CS careers
  • Targeted toward historically marginalized groups

What We Offer:

  • Introduction to programming fundamentals
  • Workshops on identity and community building
  • Guidance from Google mentors
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic history and short essays.

opportunities.title: IALR Summer Internship Program
opportunities.description: Paid 8-week internship providing on-the-job training and leadership experience for rising first-year college students in STEM.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid STEM research internship for rising college freshmen.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The goal of the IALR summer internship program is to provide students with meaningful on-the-job training and real-world leadership experience in the fields of STEM. Students commit to 224 hours of work over an eight-week commitment (28 hours/week).

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research in one of nine areas (e.g., data analysis, coding, robotics)
  • Work closely with a mentor
  • Develop real-world leadership experience

Requirements:

  • Rising first-year college student
  • Commitment to 8 weeks/224 hours

What We Offer:

  • Paid internship experience
  • Mentorship in specialized research areas
  • On-the-job training
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic history, essay, and references.

opportunities.title: Sandia National Laboratories Internships
opportunities.description: Offers summer, year-round, and co-op internships for students 16+ to gain valuable work experience in research.
opportunities.shortDescription: Research and work experience internships at a National Laboratory.
opportunities.fullDescription:
For students 16 years and older, Sandia National Laboratories offer three different types of internships: summer, year-round, and co-op. Students can gain valuable work experience concurrently with their academic studies. Some programs offer academic credits for this work, in addition to competitive pay.

Responsibilities:

  • Commit to a research project (Summer)
  • Work up to 25 hours/week during academic term (Year-round)
  • Gain first-hand work experience in a National Lab setting

Requirements:

  • Age 16+
  • Enrollment in high school
  • U.S. Citizenship/Permanent Residency

What We Offer:

  • Competitive pay
  • Academic credit (for co-op programs)
  • Exposure to high-level national security research
opportunities.applicationProcess: Apply online via the Sandia Careers portal (search 'High School').

opportunities.title: Simons Summer Research Program
opportunities.description: 10-week apprenticeship under Stony Brook University faculty, culminating in a research abstract and poster.
opportunities.shortDescription: Competitive STEM research apprenticeship at Stony Brook.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The Simons Summer Research Program offers rising high school seniors the opportunity to conduct research in a STEM field in an apprenticeship under one of Stony Brook University’s faculty mentors. Accepted students receive a stipend award at the closing poster symposium.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research under faculty mentorship for 10 weeks
  • Produce a written research abstract and poster
  • Attend special workshops and tours

Requirements:

  • Rising high school seniors
  • Strong academic record (top 1-2% of class)

What We Offer:

  • Stipend award
  • Deep, structured research experience
  • College-level networking and workshops
opportunities.applicationProcess: Nomination/application process requires transcripts, recommendations, and essays.

opportunities.title: SPARK Summer Internship Program
opportunities.description: Connects motivated high school students in the Greater Seattle area with leading educators and industry experts.
opportunities.shortDescription: Local Seattle-area research projects with businesses.
opportunities.fullDescription:
SPARK’s mission is to provide motivated high school students in the Greater Seattle area hands-on, in-depth learning by connecting them with leading educators and industry experts. Students apply to up to 5 research projects and are matched with a sponsoring business.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct a summer internship with a matched company
  • Engage in hands-on, in-depth learning
  • Work on a specific research project

Requirements:

  • High school students
  • Resident of the Greater Seattle area

What We Offer:

  • Max stipend of \$500
  • Mentorship from industry experts
  • Real-world experience with a sponsoring business
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application to research projects of interest.

opportunities.title: Meyerhoff Scholars Program
opportunities.description: Scholarship program for students pursuing a Ph.D. or combined M.D./Ph.D. in sciences or engineering.
opportunities.shortDescription: Prestigious STEM scholarship and research program (UMBC).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Meyerhoff Scholars are selected by nomination for high school students wishing to pursue a Ph.D. or combined M.D./Ph.D. in the sciences or engineering. The program is sponsored by UMBC and includes research, conferences, paid internships, and study-abroad experiences.

Responsibilities:

  • Attend a mandatory 6-week residential preparatory program
  • Participate in ongoing research and conferences
  • Maintain high academic standing

Requirements:

  • High school student (nominated)
  • Commitment to pursuing a STEM Ph.D. or M.D./Ph.D.

What We Offer:

  • Scholarship support
  • Paid internships and study abroad
  • Accelerated residential preparation
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application via nomination and subsequent interview/application process.

opportunities.title: MITRE’S High School Student Program
opportunities.description: Paid, 8-week summer positions empowering student researchers in engineering and technology fields.
opportunities.shortDescription: Paid engineering/tech research program at MITRE.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Open to all high school students 14 years or older, MITRE’s high school student program empowers student researchers to become leaders in engineering and technology fields. For the summer, MITRE plans to offer paid positions over an eight-week period.

Responsibilities:

  • Work on engineering and technology research projects
  • Collaborate with MITRE scientists
  • Develop leadership skills in technical fields

Requirements:

  • Age 14+
  • High school student
  • Interest in engineering/technology

What We Offer:

  • Paid eight-week internship
  • Exposure to government R&D projects
  • Mentorship from industry leaders
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via MITRE Careers.

opportunities.title: American Collegiate Adventures (ACA) Internship Program
opportunities.description: High school students land an internship in over 20 industries in Boston or New York, combined with structured activities.
opportunities.shortDescription: Internship and summer immersion program in NYC or Boston.
opportunities.fullDescription:
At ACA, high school students can land an internship in over 20 industries in either Boston or New York. Students spend roughly six hours a day with their internships, structured around meals and activities with other students. The program boasts a 10:1 student-to-staff ratio.

Responsibilities:

  • Work 6 hours daily at a placement internship
  • Participate in all-inclusive activities and weekend excursions
  • Engage in a structured summer schedule

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • Guaranteed internship placement
  • Residential program with excursions
  • Low student-to-staff ratio
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online enrollment and payment.

opportunities.title: EXPLORE Externships
opportunities.description: Matches gifted and advanced high school students with distinguished mentors for research and professional experience.
opportunities.shortDescription: Mentored research externship for gifted students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
EXPLORE matches gifted and advanced high school students with distinguished mentors for research opportunities and professional experience in their field of interest. The program runs throughout the academic year, with events hosted at the Institute for Educational Advancement’s learning center in Pasadena.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct ongoing research with a mentor
  • Gain professional experience in field of interest
  • Attend events at the IEA learning center

Requirements:

  • Gifted and advanced high school student
  • Commitment throughout the academic year

What We Offer:

  • Personalized research mentorship
  • Professional experience
  • Learning support from IEA
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application requires demonstration of gifted/advanced status and interview.

opportunities.title: Johns Hopkins Center for Talented Youth (CTY)
opportunities.description: Nationally recognized summer program offering classes in advanced programming, robotics, and algorithms.
opportunities.shortDescription: Advanced academic summer courses for gifted students.
opportunities.fullDescription:
CTY at Johns Hopkins runs classes across the country in such topics as advanced Java programming, Arduino prototyping, and designing inclusive algorithms. Some courses are self-paced while others follow a regular schedule, with many running throughout the year.

Responsibilities:

  • Enroll in advanced, college-level courses
  • Complete intensive academic work (in-person or online)
  • Engage in fast-paced learning environment

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Qualifying scores on standardized tests (e.g., SAT, SCAT)
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • College-level academic enrichment
  • Residential and commuter options
  • Year-round course availability
opportunities.applicationProcess: Requires CTY eligibility (qualifying test scores) and course registration.

opportunities.title: Smith Summer Science & Engineering Program (SSEP)
opportunities.description: Cooperative, investigative learning under committed faculty for exceptional high school students interested in STEM.
opportunities.shortDescription: Investigative STEM program for high school girls at Smith College.
opportunities.fullDescription:
SSEP is designed for exceptional high school students with budding interests in STEM fields. Curriculum includes offerings like 'Designing Intelligent Robots,' 'Tracking an Outbreak,' and 'Introduction to Ethical Data Science.'

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in cooperative, investigative learning
  • Engage with faculty and near-peer undergraduate TAs
  • Complete specialized STEM coursework

Requirements:

  • High school student (female preferred)
  • Exceptional academic standing
  • Interest in STEM fields

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on lab/project experience
  • Residential campus life at a women's college
  • Specialized curriculum (e.g., Ethical Data Science)
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic history, essay, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: Stanford Introduction to Logic
opportunities.description: Online course on symbolic logic to help high school students get a head start on logical thinking.
opportunities.shortDescription: Online or in-person symbolic logic course from Stanford.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Stanford University’s online course on symbolic logic can help high school students get a head start on logical thinking, which is at the core of many STEM fields. Summer camps are offered both in-person and online.

Responsibilities:

  • Master fundamentals of symbolic logic
  • Engage in rigorous problem solving
  • Access the entire course curriculum online

Requirements:

  • High school student
  • Strong math aptitude
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • Essential foundation for STEM/CS
  • Flexible online/in-person options
