  • Stanford Pre-Collegiate instruction
opportunities.applicationProcess: Enrollment or application via Stanford Pre-Collegiate.

opportunities.title: Stanford Seeds of Change
opportunities.description: Addresses the gender gap in STEM by pairing students with trained undergraduate mentors for technical training.
opportunities.shortDescription: Mentorship and technical training for girls in STEM (Stanford).
opportunities.fullDescription:
Seeds of Change aims to address the significant gender gap in STEM fields by pairing students with trained undergraduate mentors. The initiative infuses high schoolers’ technical training in subjects such as computer science with feminist pedagogy, service-learning, and experiential education.

Responsibilities:

  • Receive advice and mentorship for a STEM career
  • Engage in technical training (e.g., computer science)
  • Participate in service-learning and experiential education

Requirements:

  • High school student (girls)
  • Interest in CS/STEM careers

What We Offer:

  • Mentorship from Stanford undergraduates
  • Focus on feminist pedagogy in tech
  • Addressing the gender gap in STEM
opportunities.applicationProcess: Application via Stanford Pre-Collegiate or linked program page.

opportunities.title: UNH Tech Camp TechLeaders Program
opportunities.description: Weekly programs covering specialized topics like molecular visualization and bioinformatics.
opportunities.shortDescription: One-week in-depth tech projects at UNH.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The TechLeaders program at Tech Camp UNH has a number of weekly programs that cover specialized topics like molecular visualization and bioinformatics. They give high school students a chance to spend a single week working on an in-depth project regardless of their prior experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Spend one week on an in-depth project
  • Explore specialized topics (e.g., molecular visualization)
  • Work in a university setting

Requirements:

  • High school students
  • Interest in STEM/Technology
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • In-depth project experience (short duration)
  • Exposure to bioinformatics
  • Flexible, weekly programs
opportunities.applicationProcess: Enrollment is first-come, first-served; early registration advised.

opportunities.title: UT Science Summer Academies
opportunities.description: One-week academies in robotics, iOS app development, and game development. Includes DE&I programs.
opportunities.shortDescription: One-week CS academies at UT Austin.
opportunities.fullDescription:
UT Computer Science offers a variety of one-week summer academies for high school students ranging from freshmen to seniors. Programs include robotics, iOS app development, and game development. The department also features the Academy for Women and Academy for All geared toward addressing diversity, equity and inclusion barriers in STEM-based fields.

Responsibilities:

  • Complete a one-week specialized course (e.g., iOS app development)
  • Work on project-based learning
  • Engage in diversity/equity-focused academies (optional)

Requirements:

  • High school students (grades 9-12)
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • Specialized CS topics
  • Focus on diversity and inclusion
  • Exposure to UT Computer Science department
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online registration for specific academies.

opportunities.title: MIT Online Science, Technology, and Engineering Community (MOSTEC)
opportunities.description: Six-month free program for rising seniors, especially from underrepresented communities, with an MIT campus conference.
opportunities.shortDescription: Free, 6-month online/in-person program for underrepresented seniors.
opportunities.fullDescription:
MOSTEC is a six-month program for rising high school seniors, especially from underrepresented or underserved communities. It includes an academic phase (online courses/projects), a 5-day MIT campus conference, and an enrichment phase (interacting with researchers).

Responsibilities:

  • Complete online courses and projects (CS/Science Writing)
  • Attend a 5-day conference on MIT campus (room/board covered)
  • Interact with researchers and write online blogs

Requirements:

  • Rising high school seniors
  • From underrepresented/underserved communities

What We Offer:

  • Free program
  • Six-month commitment
  • In-person experience at MIT campus
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic history, essays, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: Emagination Tech Camps
opportunities.description: Teaches coding, game design, and engineering skills in multiple states for one- or two-week sessions.
opportunities.shortDescription: Coding and game design summer camp.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Available in six different states, Emagination teaches coding in multiple languages, different varieties of game design, and engineering skills related to computer science. High schoolers can enroll in two courses for a one-week session or four courses for a two-week session.

Responsibilities:

  • Enroll in specialized courses (coding, game design, engineering)
  • Meet for three hours daily per course
  • Participate in recreation and social activity

Requirements:

  • High school students
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • Hands-on skill building in tech
  • Multiple courses and session lengths
  • Recreational activities interspersed
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online registration and enrollment.

opportunities.title: Illinois Tech Computational Science Course
opportunities.description: Residential and daytime course in computational science where students can earn college credit.
opportunities.shortDescription: College-credit course in computational science.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Illinois Tech has residential and daytime courses in computational science. Curriculum highlights include implementation of Mathematica, number theory, and modeling scientific and engineering problems with differential equations. High schoolers can earn college credit and letters of recommendation.

Responsibilities:

  • Study number theory and differential equations
  • Model scientific and engineering problems
  • Utilize computational tools (e.g., Mathematica)

Requirements:

  • Rising 10th-12th graders
  • Completed Algebra II
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • College credit and letters of recommendation
  • Residential or commuter options
  • Advanced computational curriculum
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires transcript and academic history.

opportunities.title: Carnegie Mellon Computer Science Scholars (CSS)
opportunities.description: Grant-funded, merit-based program for rising juniors historically excluded from STEM fields.
opportunities.shortDescription: Free, merit-based CS program for underrepresented juniors (CMU).
opportunities.fullDescription:
CSS is a grant-funded, merit-based program for rising high school juniors historically excluded from STEM fields. Scholars engage in college-level courses in computer programming and mathematics, in addition to weekly seminars on college admissions and mental health.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in college-level CS and math courses
  • Participate in group research projects
  • Attend seminars on financial aid and mental health

Requirements:

  • Rising high school juniors
  • Historically excluded from STEM fields

What We Offer:

  • Grant-funded (free) program
  • College admissions support
  • Field trips to industry leaders
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application requires academic history, essays, and recommendations.

opportunities.title: MSU High School Engineering Institute (HSEI)
opportunities.description: In-depth, one-week experience in college engineering majors with a faculty member and graduate student.
opportunities.shortDescription: One-week engineering major deep dive at MSU.
opportunities.fullDescription:
Juniors and seniors are invited to apply to HSEI at Michigan State University, a program designed to give high schoolers an in-depth experience in college engineering majors. Students will spend one week with a faculty member and a graduate student.

Responsibilities:

  • Engage in lectures, demonstrations, and team-based problem solving
  • Work closely with a faculty member and graduate student
  • Participate in campus tours

Requirements:

  • Rising Juniors and Seniors
  • Interest in engineering majors
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • In-depth exposure to one engineering major
  • Hands-on problem-solving
  • Faculty mentorship
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online application via MSU Engineering portal.

opportunities.title: Georgia Tech Summer Programs for Enrichment (PEAKS)
opportunities.description: Increase STEAM knowledge through hands-on and engaging experiential activities, including introductions to computer science.
opportunities.shortDescription: Hands-on STEAM enrichment programs at Georgia Tech.
opportunities.fullDescription:
The PEAKS programs at Georgia Tech are designed to increase STEAM knowledge through hands-on and engaging experiential activities. These programs may be a good introduction into computer science for students with no prior coding experience.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in hands-on STEAM activities
  • Gain foundational knowledge in computer science (some tracks)
  • Explore accelerated knowledge areas

Requirements:

  • High school students (various grades)
  • Tuition fee applies

What We Offer:

  • Experiential learning focus
  • Introduction to coding for beginners
  • Exposure to Georgia Tech campus and faculty
opportunities.applicationProcess: Online registration for specific PEAKS programs.
